title: આજનું હવામાન : મુંબઈમાં અટવાયેલું ચોમાસુ થોડાક જ દિવસમાં આવશે ગુજરાત, આ વિસ્તારોમાં પડશે ભારે વરસાદ,... - TV9 Gujarati
article_text:
Gujarati News Videos Gujarat Videos Heavy Rains Forecast In Some Areas Of Gujarat Monsson 2025 Video
આજનું હવામાન : મુંબઈમાં અટવાયેલું ચોમાસુ થોડાક જ દિવસમાં આવશે ગુજરાત, આ વિસ્તારોમાં પડશે ભારે વરસાદ, જુઓ Video
Disha Thakar | Updated on: Jun 15, 2025 | 7:26 AM

હવામાન વિભાગની આગાહી અનુસાર ગુજરાતમાં આગામી 5 દિવસ મધ્યમથી ભારે વરસાદની શક્યતા છે. હવામાન વિભાગની આગાહી મુજબ દક્ષિણ ગુજરાત અને સૌરાષ્ટ્રમાં ગાજવીજ સાથે વરસાદ પડી શકે છે.

આજે રાજ્યના અનેક જિલ્લાઓમાં છૂટા-છવાયા વરસાદની આગાહી કરવામાં આવી છે. જ્યારે બનાસકાંઠા, પાટણ, મહેસાણા, અમદાવાદ, ખેડા, મહિસાગરમાં ગાજવીજ સાથે હળવાથી મધ્યમ વરસાદની શક્યતા છે.ચોમાસુ હજુ પણ મુંબઈમાં જ સ્થિર છે.2 થી 3 દિવસમાં ચોમાસુ આગળ વધે તેવી સંભાવના છે.રાજ્ય ભરમાં લાંબા સમયથી વરસાદની રાહ જોવાઈ રહી છે ત્યારે આગાહી મુજબ વરસાદ પડે તો અનેક વિસ્તારોમાં લોકોને ઉકળાટથી રાહત મળશે.

અંબાલાલ પટેલે ચોમાસાની કરી આગાહી

હવામાન શાસ્ત્રી અંબાલાલ પટેલે રાજ્યમાં ચોમાસાના આગામને લઈને પણ આગાહી કરી છે. મુંબઈમાં અટવાયેલું ચોમાસું ગુજરાતમાં 13 તારીખ પછી આવી શકે તેવી આગાહી કરી છે. દક્ષિણ ગુજરાતમાં 26 જૂનથી ગાજવીજ સાથે વરસાદ પડે તેવી આગાહી કરી છે. આંધી તૂફાન સાથે અનેક વિસ્તારોમાં છૂટો છવાયો વરસાદ વરસી શકે છે.

સામાન્ય રીતે રોજબરોજના તાપમાનને હવામાન કહેવાય છે. જ્યારે આબોહવામાં થતા ફેરફારને પણ આપણે હવામાન તરીકે ઓળખીએ છે. ભારતમાં શિયાળો, ઉનાળો અને ચોમાસુ આ રીતે ત્રણ પ્રકારની ઋતુઓ હોય છે. ઋતુઓને લગતા અન્ય સમાચાર વાંચવા અહીં ક્લિક કરો.

title: ગોંડલમાં એક કલાકમાં ચાર ઇંચ ખાબક્યો, આજે 15 જિલ્લામાં ભારેથી અતિભારે વરસાદની આગાહી - News18 Gujarati
article_text:
ગોંડલમાં એક કલાકમાં ચાર ઇંચ ખાબક્યો, આજે 15 જિલ્લામાં ભારેથી અતિભારે વરસાદની આગાહી
Published by:
Kaushal Pancholi
news18 gujarati
Last Updated:
June 15, 2025 7:18 AM IST
હવામાન વિભાગે કરેલી આગાહી પ્રમાણે, ગુજરાતના કેટલાક ભાગોમાં આગામી ત્રણ દિવસ દરમિયાન ભારેથી અતિ ભારે વરસાદ થઇ શકે છે અને રાજ્યના અન્ય ભાગોમાં પણ વરસાદી માહોલ બને તેવી શક્યતા છે.
Follow us on Google News
1/5
અમદાવાદ: શહેરમાં શનિવારે રાતે અચાનક હવામાનમાં પલટો આવ્યો હતો. શનિવારે દિવસભર ભારે ગરમી અને બફારા બાદ રાત્રે ધૂળની ડમરી સાથે વંટોળ ફૂંકાયો હતો. આ સાથે અનેક વિસ્તારોમાં હળવો વરસાદ પણ વરસ્યો હતો. પશ્ચિમ રાજસ્થાનનમાં અપર એર સાયક્લોનિક સર્ક્યુલેશન છે, જ્યારે મહારાષ્ટ્રમાં પણ અપર એર સાયક્લોનિક સર્ક્યુલેશન છે. જ્યારે બંગાળની ખાડીમાં 2 સાયક્લોનિક સર્ક્યુલેશન છે. તો બીજીતરફ હવામાન વિભાગે આગાહી મુજબ 24 કલાકમાં દક્ષિણ ગુજરાતમાં સત્તાવાર રીતે નૈઋુત્યનું ચોમાસું બેસી શકે છે. ત્યારે હવામાન વિભાગે કરેલી આગાહી પ્રમાણે, ગુજરાતના કેટલાક ભાગોમાં આગામી ત્રણ દિવસ દરમિયાન ભારેથી અતિ ભારે વરસાદ થઇ શકે છે અને રાજ્યના અન્ય ભાગોમાં પણ વરસાદી માહોલ બને તેવી શક્યતા છે.
ADVERTISEMENT
2/5
શનિવારે રાજકોટના ગોંડલમાં એક કલાકમાં ધોધમાર 4 ઇંચ વરસાદ ખાબક્યો હતો. શહેરમાં ગાજવીજ તેમજ પવન સાથે ધોધમાર વરસાદ વરસતા રાજમાર્ગો પર ગોઠણ ડૂબ પાણી ભરાયા હતા. શહેરમાં ધોધમાર વરસાદને પગલે અનેક નીચાણવાળા વિસ્તારોમાં વરસાદી પાણી ભરાયા હતા. ચોટીલા અને અમરેલી પંથકમાં પણ વરસાદ નોંધાયો છે.
ADVERTISEMENT
3/5
દાહોદમાં ગાજવીજ સાથે ત્રાટકેલા વરસાદમાં વીજળી પડવાથી ત્રણનાં મોત થયા છે. જ્યારે રાજકોટમાં ભારે વરસાદ સાથે વીજળી પડતા દલુભાઈ બીજલભાઈ બારૈયા (45)નું મોત નિપજ્યું છે. ચરોતરમાં ખેડા અને આણંદ જિલ્લામાં સાંજે વરસાદ નોંધાયો હતો.
ADVERTISEMENT
4/5
હવામાન વિભાગની આગાહી મુજબ, આજે રવિવારે, 15મી જૂને 15 જિલ્લામાં ભારેથી અતિભારે વરસાદની આગાહી છે. જેમાં અમરેલી, ભાવનગર, નવસારી, વલસાડ જિલ્લાના છૂટાછવાયા સ્થળોએ ગાજવીજ સાથે અતિભારે વરસાદને પગલે ઓરેન્જ એલર્ટ આપવામાં આવી છે. જ્યારે રાજકોટ, જૂનાગઢ, ગીર સોમનાથ, અરવલ્લી, મહીસાગર, દાહોદ, ભરૂચ, નર્મદા, સુરત, તાપી, ડાંગ જિલ્લામાં ગાજવીજ સાથે ભારે વરસાદને લઈને યલો એલર્ટ જાહેર કર્યું છે.
ADVERTISEMENT
5/5
સોમવારની વાત કરીએ તો, રાજ્યમાં 16 જૂને રાજકોટ, અમરેલી, ભાવનગર, સુરત, નવસારી, વલસાડમાં અતિભારે વરસાદનું ઓરેન્જ એલર્ટ હવામાન વિભાગે આપ્યું છે. આ સાથે બોટાદ, જૂનાગઢ, ગીર સોમનાથ, આણંદ, વડોદરા, છોટા ઉદેપુર, ભરૂચ, નર્મદા, તાપી, ડાંગ જિલ્લાના છૂટાછવાયા સ્થળોએ ગાજવીજ સાથે ભારે વરસાદને લઈને હવામાન વિભાગે યલો એલર્ટ જાહેર કર્યું છે. નોંધનીય છે કે, 15-16 જૂન દરમિયાન રાજ્યના મોટાભાગના વિસ્તારોમાં મેઘગર્જના સાથે 30-40 કિ.મી.ની ઝડપે પવન ફૂંકાવવાની આગાહી છે.

title: ગુજરાતમાં ચોમાસાની ધમાકેદાર એન્ટ્રી થતા જ આવી અતિભારે વરસાદની આગાહી, અંબાલાલે આપી તારીખ - Zee News
article_text:
ગુજરાતી ન્યૂઝફોટો
ગુજરાતમાં ચોમાસાની ધમાકેદાર એન્ટ્રી થતા જ આવી અતિભારે વરસાદની આગાહી, અંબાલાલે આપી તારીખ

Gujarat Monsoon 2025 Prediction : ગુજરાતમાં ચોમાસાની ધમાકેદાર એન્ટ્રી થઈ છે. ત્યારે હવે ગુજરાતીઓએ આજે શુકનની લાપસી બનાવવી જોઈએ. ગુજરાતમાં ચોમાસાની એન્ટ્રી વિશે અંબાલાલ પટેલની આગાહી પણ આવી ગઈ છે. 

Updated:Jun 15, 2025, 09:53 AM IST
આજથી રાજ્યભરમાં જામશે વરસાદી માહોલ 
1/5

હવામાન વિભાગે ગુજરાતમાં વરસાદના આગમન સાથે ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી કરી છે. 15થી 18 જૂન સુધી વરસાદી એક્ટિવિટી વધશે. 15 અને 16 જૂને ભારે પવન ફૂંકાવાનું એલર્ટ છે. 16 અને 17 જૂને ભારે પવન સાથે વરસાદ આવશે. માછીમારોને હાલ દરિયો ન ખેડવા સૂચના અપાઈ છે.  

ગુજરાતમાં ચોમાસાની શરૂઆત - અંબાલાલ પટેલ 
2/5

હવામાન આગાહીકાર અંબાલાલની ચોમાસાની આગાહી આવી છે. કેટલાક ભાગોમાં ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી છે. અંબાલાલ પટેલે જણાવ્યું કે, કેટલાક સાયક્લોનિક સર્કલયુશેનના કારણે 18 જુન થી 24 જુને ઉત્તર ગુજરાતમાં ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી છે. મધ્ય ગુજરાતમાં પણ ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી છે. 

ક્યાં ક્યાં વરસાદ આવશે 
3/5

વડોદરા, પંચમહાલ અને આણંદની આગાહી છે. દક્ષિણ ગુજરાતમાં સુરત, નવસારી, વલસાડ અને ભરૂચમાં ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી છે. સૌરાષ્ટ્રના કેટલાકમાં ભાગોમાં વરસાદની આગાહી છે. મધ્યપ્રદેશના બોર્ડર જિલ્લામાં ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી છે. 22 તારીખથી બંગાળમાં સિસ્ટમમાં સક્રિય થતા ગુજરાતમા 24 થી 30 ગુજરાતમા વરસાદની આગાહી છે. 

ગુજરાતમાં ચોમાસું બેઠું 
4/5

ગુજરાતના 104 તાલુકામાં વિધિવત ચોમાસું બેઠું છે. હવામાન વિભાગે 18 જૂન સુધી રાજ્યમાં ભારે વરસાદની આગાહી છે. ચોમાસું 25 જૂન સુધી દેશના મોટાભાગના વિસ્તારોને આવરી લેશે. મધ્ય ભારતના કેટલાક બાકીના ભાગો ઉપરાંત પૂર્વમાં ચોમાસાનો 18 જૂન સુધીમાં સત્તાવાર પ્રારંભ થઈ શકે છે. 

5/5

ગત સાંજે રાજ્યમાં ભારે ગાજવીજ સાથે ત્રાટકેલા વરસાદે 6 લોકોના જીવ લીધા છે. દાહોદમાં વીજળી પડતાં 2 લોકોનાં મોત થયા છે. તો સુરત, પંચમહાલ, રાજકોટ અને છોટાઉદેપુરમાં વીજળીથી 4 લોકોનાં મોત થયા છે.

title: Heavy rain to lash Kerala till June 18, IMD issues red alert for five districts - lokmattimes.com
article_text:
Heavy rain to lash Kerala till June 18, IMD issues red alert for five districts

By IANS | Updated: June 15, 2025 09:03 IST

Thiruvananthapuram, June 15 The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast widespread heavy to very heavy rainfall across Kerala ...
Heavy rain to lash Kerala till June 18, IMD issues red alert for five districts

Thiruvananthapuram, June 15 The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast widespread heavy to very heavy rainfall across Kerala till June 18, prompting authorities to issue red, orange, and yellow alerts for multiple districts.

Squally weather conditions are also expected along the state’s coastline, leading to a ban on fishing activities.

A red alert, indicating extremely heavy rainfall exceeding 20 cm in 24 hours, has been issued for Malappuram and Kozhikode on June 17. The alert is extended to Wayanad, Kannur, and Kasaragod on June 18, as monsoon activity intensifies in the northern districts. The red alert represents the most severe weather warnings, indicating extremely heavy rainfall within 24 hours.

An orange alert, which signals very heavy rain ranging from 11 to 20 cm, has been announced for Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, and Palakkad on June 16,17.

The weather department has also issued an orange alert on June 18 in Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur, and Kasaragod.

Several other districts are under yellow alert, which is issued for expected heavy rainfall between 6 and 11 cm. The IMD has issued a yellow alert for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, and Alappuzha on June 17, while on June 18 yellow alert is issued for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Ernakulam, Idukki, and Thrissur.

In addition to rainfall alerts, the IMD has warned of squally weather with wind speeds of 40 to 50 kmph, gusting up to 60 kmph along and off the Kerala coast.

These conditions are expected to prevail until June 18.

Fishermen have been strictly advised not to venture into the sea during this period due to the risk of rough sea conditions.

State disaster management officials have urged residents in vulnerable areas to exercise caution, particularly in hilly regions prone to landslides and flooding.

Local administrations have been instructed to stay on high alert and prepare for emergency response as needed. The government has also asked the public to stay updated through official weather bulletins and follow safety instructions issued by authorities.

title: Southwest monsoon intensifies, water level rises in key reservoirs in two TN districts - lokmattimes.com
article_text:
Southwest monsoon intensifies, water level rises in key reservoirs in two TN districts

By IANS | Updated: June 15, 2025 08:48 IST

Chennai, June 15 The intensification of the southwest monsoon has brought continuous rainfall to the Western Ghats region, ...
Southwest monsoon intensifies, water level rises in key reservoirs in two TN districts

Chennai, June 15 The intensification of the southwest monsoon has brought continuous rainfall to the Western Ghats region, leading to a significant rise in the water levels of key reservoirs in Tamil Nadu’s Tirunelveli and Tenkasi districts.

According to Public Works Department (PWD) officials, sustained showers over the past several days have contributed to increased inflow into the region’s main water bodies, notably the Papanasam, Servalar, and Manimuthar reservoirs.

The Papanasam reservoir, one of the major sources of irrigation and drinking water in the region, recorded a water level of 126.55 feet as of Saturday. It received an inflow of 2,845.43 cubic feet per second (cusecs), while the outflow was maintained at 1,400 cusecs to meet agricultural and domestic water needs.

The Servalar reservoir also witnessed a steady rise in water level, reaching 135.17 feet.

Meanwhile, the Manimuthar reservoir stood at 93.43 feet, with water levels gradually climbing due to persistent monsoon showers. Authorities noted that the ongoing rainfall in the upper catchment areas of the Western Ghats is expected to further elevate water levels in the coming days.

Officials are closely monitoring inflows and managing reservoir releases to ensure sufficient water availability for irrigation while simultaneously taking precautionary measures to prevent flooding in downstream areas.

“We are releasing water in a controlled manner to support agricultural activities and drinking water supply, while also ensuring that there is no overflow or threat to low-lying areas,” said a senior PWD engineer overseeing water management in the region.

Local farmers have welcomed the timely rains, expressing hope for a productive cropping season ahead.

The increased reservoir levels are also likely to bring relief to communities that have faced water scarcity during the summer months.

With the southwest monsoon expected to remain active in the region for the next few weeks, the PWD and district administrations remain on alert to manage both water conservation and flood risk mitigation effectively.

title: Weather Today: हवाओं का चक्र एक बार फिर बदला,मुंबई और गुजरात में आज भारी बारिश,MP में छुटपुट वर्षा, भारी बारिश की संभावना 3 दिन बाद! - Mediawala
article_text:
Weather Today: हवाओं का चक्र एक बार फिर बदला,मुंबई और गुजरात में आज भारी बारिश,MP में छुटपुट वर्षा, भारी बारिश की संभावना 3 दिन बाद!
By Mediawala -
June 15, 2025
103
Weather Today: हवाओं का चक्र एक बार फिर बदला,मुंबई और गुजरात में आज भारी बारिश,MP में छुटपुट वर्षा, भारी बारिश की संभावना 3 दिन बाद!

दिनेश सोलंकी की खास रिपोर्ट 

महाराष्ट्र के पश्चिमी भाग में आज भारी बारिश की संभावना है। यहां बादल मध्य प्रदेश से उतरकर महाराष्ट्र और महाराष्ट्र से गुजरात की ओर बढ़ रहे हैं। हवाओं का चक्र एक बार फिर से बदल गया है।इससे गुजरात और राजस्थान समेत पंजाब, दिल्ली, हिमाचल प्रदेश और कश्मीर में आज बारिश की संभावना बन रही है।

दरअसल भारत के उत्तर – पश्चिम में हवाएं ऊंची होने से बादलों का रुख भारत के शीर्ष पर उत्तर से पूर्व की ओर हो रहा है, इससे भारत के पश्चिमी तट के बादल महाराष्ट्र से गुजरात, गुजरात से राजस्थान, राजस्थान से उत्तर भारत की ओर जाते हुए पूर्वी राज्यों से टर्न ले रहे हैं। यहां से बादल बंगाल की खाड़ी में उतरकर दक्षिणी राज्यों की तरफ मुड़ रहे हैं। इस तरह एक गोलाकार चक्र भारत में चल रहा है।

मध्य प्रदेश में बादलों का रुख आक्रामक है। यहां बादल उत्तर पूर्व से प्रवेश कर रहे हैं जो पश्चिम में जाकर वापस उत्तर की ओर बढ़ रहे हैं। इससे शाम से रात के बीच में बादल पश्चिमी मध्य प्रदेश में बरस रहे हैं। लेकिन भारी बारिश की संभावना हवाओं का रुख बदलने से अब तीन दिन बाद हो सकती है।

 

मध्य प्रदेश के तापमान में तेजी से गिरावट आई है। उत्तरी क्षेत्र में अधिकतम तापमान 45 डिग्री से उतरकर 41 तक पहुंच गया है जो अगले 24 घंटे में ही 38 तक चल जाएगा। इंदौर में भी गिरावट आई है यहां आज 32 डिग्री तापमान हो गया जो 48 घंटे में 28 डिग्री तक पहुंच जाएगा। इसी तरह रात के पारे में भी गिरावट आ रही है। इंदौर सहित पश्चिमी मध्य प्रदेश में शाम से मौसम फिर बदल सकता है, बिजली कड़कने के साथ तेज बारिश हो सकती है।

बंगाल की खाड़ी से बादलों की निरंतर आवाजाही दक्षिण राज्यों की ओर चल रही है इसमें पूर्व से आ रहे हैं मानसून के बादल भी मिले हुए हैं जो दोपहर बाद दक्षिण राज्यों में अच्छी बारिश कर सकते हैं। आज उत्तर प्रदेश, बिहार के भी कई हिस्सों में बारिश की संभावना है।

title: Rajasthan Weather Update: मानसून की दस्तक करीब, दक्षिणी इलाके में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, कई जगह आंधी का अलर्ट - Amar Ujala
article_text:
Rajasthan Weather Update: मानसून की दस्तक करीब, दक्षिणी इलाके में भारी बारिश की चेतावनी, कई जगह आंधी का अलर्ट
न्यूज डेस्क, अमर उजाला, जयपुर Published by: प्रिया वर्मा Updated Sun, 15 Jun 2025 07:56 AM IST
सार
3513 Followers
जयपुर
भीषण गर्मी का दौर झेल रहे राजस्थान में आज तेज अंधड़ और बारिश हो सकती है। मौसम विभाग ने प्रदेश के 26 शहरों में ऑरेंज श्रेणी का अलर्ट जारी किया है। इसमें 60 किमी प्रतिघंटा की रफ्तार से तेज हवाएं चलने के साथ कई जगहों पर भारी बारिश की चेतावनी भी है।
राजस्थान - फोटो : अमर उजाला
विस्तार
Follow Us

राजस्थान में आज मौसम फिर करवट लेता नजर आ रहा है। मौसम विभाग ने आज प्रदेश के 26 शहरों में आंधी और मेघगर्जन का ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया है। इसके साथ ही दक्षिणी हिस्से में भारी वर्षा की चेतावनी भी दी है। जयपुर मौसम केंद्र के अनुसार राजस्थान के पास एक नया पश्चिमी विक्षोभ सक्रिय हो रहा है। इसके प्रभाव से उदयपुर, जयपुर, जोधपुर, बीकानेर, कोटा व भरतपुर संभाग में तेज आंधी चलेगी। मौसम में बदलाव से तापमान में भी गिरावट देखने को मिल रही है। मौसम विभाग का कहना है कि अगले 24 घंटों में प्रदेश में अधिकतम तापमान में 3 से 4 डिग्री तक की गिरावट आ सकती है। इससे प्रदेश में चल रही हीटवेव्स से भी राहत मिलेगी।

Trending Videos


ये भी पढ़ें: जैसलमेर में मौसम ने लिया करवट: भीषण गर्मी के बीच सुबह हुई हल्की बारिश, लोगों को मिली राहत
विज्ञापन


यहां भारी वर्षा की चेतावनी

मौसम विभाग ने आज डूंगरपुर, प्रतापगढ़, राजसमंद, सिरोही और उदयपुर में भारी वर्षा की चेतावनी दी है। शनिवार को भी प्रदेश के कई शहरों में हल्की बारिश दर्ज की गई थी। प्रदेश के मौसम में आया यह बदलाव 20 जून तक जारी रहेगा। इसके बाद पूरे प्रदेश में बारिश की गतिविधियों में इजाफा होगा।


प्रदेश में बीते 24 घंटों के दौरान अधिकतम तापमान की स्थिति इस प्रकार रही। सर्वाधिक तापमान गंगानगर तथा चूरू में 46.5 डिग्री सेल्सियस दर्ज किया गया। वहीं लूणकरणसर में 44.4, दौसा में 44.3, बीकानेर में 46, चित्तौड़गढ़ में 42.8, कोटा में 43.2, सीकर में 43.8, पिलानी में 43.6 तथा जयपुर में 42.3 डिग्री सेल्सियस तापमान रहा।

title: MP June 15 Weather Update: Rain & Thunderstorm Alert In 47 Districts Including Bhopal, Indore & Others; - Free Press Journal
article_text:
Bhopal (Madhya Pradesh): The Meteorological Department has issued an alert for strong winds and rainfall in 47 districts including Bhopal, Indore, Ujjain, Gwalior, on Sunday.

Similar weather was witnessed on Saturday with severe storms hitting several districts causing mayhem in daily life.

Weather expected on Sunday  

Rain and strong winds are likely in Bhopal, Indore, Ujjain, Gwalior, Morena, Bhind, Datia, Rewa, Panna, Damoh, Mandla, Balaghat, Seoni, Pandhurna, Chhindwara, Narsinghpur, Sagar, Vidisha, Raisen, Narmadapuram, Betul, Harda, Sehore, Shajapur, Dewas, Khandwa, Burhanpur, Khargone, Barwani, Dhar, Alirajpur, Jhabua, Ratlam, Mandsaur, Sheopur, Shivpuri, Ashoknagar, Guna, Rajgarh, Agar-Malwa, Satna, Maihar, Mauganj, Katni, Jabalpur, Dindori, and Neemuch.

What do meteorologists say?

The weather department has issued an alert for thunderstorms and rain in most parts of the state. Wind speeds may reach up to 40–60 km/h in these areas.

The monsoon, which reached India 8 days early this year, is expected to enter Madhya Pradesh by June 16 or 17. Although it was initially expected in early June, its movement was stalled over Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh for about 15 days. Now that it is advancing again, MP should see monsoon rains soon.

Last year, the monsoon arrived in the state on June 21, while the average arrival date is June 15.

Temperature records

The temperature soared above 40°C in several districts of Madhya Pradesh, including Damoh, Shajapur, Tikamgarh, Rewa, Narsinghpur, Khargone, Guna, Shivpuri, Umaria, Khandwa, Betul, and Sagar.

Among the five major cities Bhopal recorded 40.4°C, Indore recorded 38.8°C, Gwalior was the hottest at 42.5°C, Ujjain recorded 40°C and Jabalpur recorded 40.3°C.

Cyclonic circulations affecting Madhya Pradesh at present | IMD Bhopal

title: UP Monsoon Alert: When will the monsoon arrive in Uttar Pradesh? Rain warning in these districts - Times Bull
article_text:
New Delhi: North India is still waiting for monsoon rains. Due to a yearning for water, farmers are looking towards the sky to see when the monsoon will arrive. It is expected that the wait for the monsoon will soon come to an end. In some parts of Uttar Pradesh, unmonsoon rains brought relief from the heat two days ago. On Saturday, people were drenched in heat due to the increase in temperature throughout the day.

The heat was such that even pedestrians were seen walking on the road with umbrellas. It is being speculated that the monsoon may enter UP between June 20 and 25. Currently, the paddy plantation jungle lies vacant, waiting for rain. The Indian Meteorological Department has issued an alert for rain accompanied by thunder and lightning in many districts of Uttar Pradesh. People are expected to be cautious inn thissituation.

How will the weather be in these districts?

According to IMD, there is a possibility of gusty winds in Banda, Chitrakoot, Kaushambi, Prayagraj, Fatehpur, and Pratapgarh on Sunday. Apart from these, a strong wind alert has been issued in Sonbhadra, Mirzapur, Chandauli, Varanasi and Sant Ravidas Nagar. There is a possibility of rain with thunder in Jaunpur, Ghazipur and Azamgarh.

Additionally, an alert for light rain has been issued for Mau, Ballia, Deoria, Gorakhpur, Sant Kabir Nagar, and Basti. A warning of light rain has also been issued in Kushinagar, Maharajganj, Siddharth Nagar, Gonda, Balrampur, Shravasti, Bahraich and Lakhimpur Kheri.

An alert of thunder and lightning has been issued in Sitapur, Hardoi, Kanpur Dehat, Kanpur Nagar, Unnao, Lucknow, Barabanki and Rae Bareli. Gusty winds can also blow here.

Possibility of gusty winds and thunder here

According to the Meteorological Department, there may be rain accompanied by strong winds in Ayodhya, Ambedkar Nagar, Saharanpur, Shamli, Muzaffarnagar, and Baghpat of Uttar Pradesh. Apart from these, rain with thunder is expected in Meerut, Mathura, Agra, Firozabad, Mainpuri, Etawah, Auraiya, Bijnor, and Amroha. There is a possibility of strong winds in Moradabad, Rampur, Bareilly, Pilibhit, Jalaun, Hamirpur, Mahoba, Jhansi, Lalitpur and many other areas.

When can the monsoon arrive?

According to the Meteorological Department, the monsoon can enter Uttar Pradesh anytime after June 20. Starting from eastern Uttar Pradesh, it can gradually pick up speed as it moves towards the western parts. There is a possibility of rain in most parts of the state between June 18 and 20.

UP Weather Alert: उत्तर प्रदेश के कई जिलों में बीते 24 घंटों में हुई बारिश और तेज हवाओं ने मौसम को सुहाना बना दिया. इस बीच अब फिर मौसम विभाग ने अगले 2-3 दिनों तक बारिश और आंधी का अनुमान जताया है. साथ ही मॉनसून के जल्द दस्तक देने की संभावना भी जताई है.

न्यूज तक
15 Jun 2025 (अपडेटेड: Jun 15 2025 3:56 AM)

UP Weather Alert: उत्तर प्रदेश के कई जिलों में बीते 24 घंटों में हुई बारिश और तेज हवाओं ने मौसम को सुहाना बना दिया. बिजनौर के धामपुर में सबसे ज्यादा 8 सेमी बारिश दर्ज की गई. वहीं, गोरखपुर, बरेली और मुरादाबाद जैसे इलाकों में तापमान में गिरावट से लोगों को गर्मी से राहत मिली. मौसम विभाग ने अगले 2-3 दिनों तक बारिश और आंधी का अनुमान जताया है. साथ ही मॉनसून के जल्द दस्तक देने की संभावना भी जताई है.

अगले 2-3 दिन कैसा रहेगा मौसम?

मौसम विभाग के मुताबिक, 15 से 17 जून तक पश्चिमी और पूर्वी यूपी में बारिश का सिलसिला जारी रहने की संभावना है. वहीं, पश्चिमी यूपी में कुछ जिलों में गरज और चमक के साथ बौछारें पड़ सकती हैं, जबकि पूर्वी यूपी में कई जगहों पर अच्छी बारिश की संभावना है. 15 जून को पश्चिमी यूपी में 30-40 किमी/घंटा की रफ्तार से हवाएं चल सकती हैं, वहीं पूर्वी यूपी में 40-50 किमी/घंटा की तेज हवाओं के साथ आंधी और बिजली गिरने का अलर्ट है.

15 जून के लिए जारी किया गया अलर्ट

पश्चिमी यूपी: कुछ जिलों में तेज हवाओं के साथ आंधी और बिजली गिरने की संभावना है.

UP Weather Alert: 12 जून को यूपी के इन जिलों में हो सकती है बारिश, कई जगहों पर लू और गर्म हवाओं की चेतावनी! जानिए अपने जिले का हाल

Jun 12 2025 3:56 AM

Jun 10 2025 10:08 AM

Jun 10 2025 9:43 AM

पूर्वी यूपी: कुछ स्थानों पर तेज झोंकों वाली हवाओं के साथ गरज-चमक, बारिश और बिजली गिरने की आशंका है.

जल्द शुरू हो सकती है मानसूनी बारिश

भारतीय मौसम विभाग (IMD) के मुताबिक, अगले दो दिनों में मॉनसून गुजरात, विदर्भ, छत्तीसगढ़ और ओडिशा में आगे बढ़ेगा. इसके बाद बिहार, झारखंड और पश्चिम बंगाल में भी मॉनसून पहुंच सकता है. उत्तर प्रदेश में भी मॉनसून के लिए परिस्थितियां अनुकूल हो रही हैं. यहां जल्द ही मानसूनी बारिश शुरू होने की उम्मीद है.

किन जिलों में हुई कितनी बारिश?

मौसम विभाग के अनुसार बीते 24 में पश्चिमी यूपी के बिजनौर, मुरादाबाद और रामपुर में अच्छी बारिश हुई. बिजनौर के नगीना में 5 सेमी और नजीबाबाद में 1 सेमी बारिश दर्ज की गई. मुरादाबाद के ठाकुरद्वारा और बिलारी में 3-3 सेमी, जबकि रामपुर के बिलासपुर में 2 सेमी बारिश हुई. पूर्वी यूपी के बस्ती और बहराइच में भी 1-2 सेमी बारिश रिकॉर्ड की गई. हालांकि, कुछ इलाकों में लू चलने की भी खबरें हैं.

तापमान में कितनी राहत?

वहीं, बीते 24 में मुरादाबाद, बरेली, मेरठ और गोरखपुर मंडलों में अधिकतम तापमान में 2.1°C से 4.0°C तक गिरावट दर्ज की गई. इस दौरान नजीबाबाद में सबसे कम तापमान 22.0°C दर्ज किया गया. हालांकि, राज्य में सबसे ज्यादा  तापमान आगरा का रहा.  यहां पारा 45.0°C तक पहुंचा गया. लखनऊ, कानपुर, वाराणसी और अयोध्या में रात का तापमान सामान्य से ज्यादा रहा.

सावधानी बरतने की अपील 

बिजनौर, मुरादाबाद, बस्ती जैसे इलाकों में पहले से बारिश और आंधी देखी गई है, इसलिए इन जिलों में विशेष सावधानी की जरूरत है. तेज हवाओं और बिजली गिरने के खतरे को देखते हुए मौसम विभाग ने लोगों से सुरक्षित रहने की अपील की है.

ये भी पढ़ें: गांव में अकेली थी पत्नी, तभी शुरू हुआ इश्क का खेल... फिर जो हुआ उसने रिश्तों को कर दिया शर्मसार, बदायूं की अजीब प्रेम की गजब कहानी

title: Storm and Rain Alert in 47 Districts of Madhya Pradesh - Ground Report
article_text:
Home  Latest  Storm And Rain Alert In 47 Districts Of Madhya Pradesh
Storm and Rain Alert in 47 Districts of Madhya Pradesh

Madhya Pradesh faces storms and rain in 47 districts with winds up to 60 km/h. Rail traffic hit, property damaged, and heatwave continues before monsoon.

BY Ground Report Desk  15 Jun 2025

 Follow Us

Heavy storm and rain disrupt life in Madhya Pradesh's major cities. Photo credit: Ground Report

Listen to this article
0.75x
1x
1.5x
00:00 / 00:00

Heavy storm and rain hit several districts in Madhya Pradesh on Saturday. Strong winds uprooted trees, damaged property, and disrupted train services. The Meteorological Department has issued an alert for 47 districts, including Bhopal and Indore. Rain and thunderstorms are expected to continue on Sunday, with wind speeds ranging from 40 to 60 kilometers per hour.

Districts likely to be affected include Bhopal, Indore, Ujjain, Gwalior, Morena, Rewa, Sagar, Jabalpur, Chhindwara, Neemuch, and many others across the state. In Neemuch, strong winds blew away a tin shed from a house. In Ujjain, a tree fell on the railway track between Berchha and Peer Amrood, halting several trains. Train 19340, running from Bhopal to Dahod, was stopped midway due to the obstruction.

Even with the storms, heat conditions remain severe in many parts of MP. Narmadapuram recorded the highest temperature of 45.2°C. Khajuraho and Naugaon followed closely with over 44°C. Here's a look at high temperatures reported across the state:

City	Temperature (°C)
Narmadapuram	45.2
Khajuraho	44.7
Naugaon	44.6
Gwalior	42.5
Satna	43.1
Sidhi	43.0
Bhopal	40.4
Indore	38.8
Ujjain	40.0
Jabalpur	40.3

The monsoon, which entered the country eight days early, has stalled for over two weeks in Maharashtra and Chhattisgarh. It was expected to enter MP in early June, but due to the delay, it is now likely to reach by June 16 or 17. The normal date of monsoon arrival in Madhya Pradesh is June 15. Last year, it entered the state on June 21.

This summer, MP recorded 43 consecutive days of storm or rain from April 26 to June 7. On the 44th day, there was a break, but the rain returned soon after. May witnessed unusual weather with rainfall and thunderstorms reported daily in most districts. Only Niwari district saw very light rain, which wasn’t recorded officially.

Rainfall records were broken in Indore and Ujjain. Indore received 114.8 mm of rain in May—its highest in 139 years. The previous record was 107.7 mm, set in 1886. Ujjain saw 111.8 mm of rainfall, breaking its 2021 record of 65 mm.

May was cooler than April this year. In April, some cities crossed 45°C. In May, day temperatures stayed below 43°C across most of the state. Even during Nautapa, which usually brings extreme heat, temperatures were lower than usual in many cities.

Explaining the reason for the unusual weather, meteorologist Dr. Surendran said, “From the beginning of May till the end, cyclonic circulation, western disturbances, and trough activity were active in the state. These weather systems didn’t stop and kept triggering rain and storms throughout the month.”

title: MP Monsoon Alert: There will be rain with thunder in 40 districts of Madhya Pradesh - Times Bull
article_text:
New Delhi: People of Madhya Pradesh have got relief from the weather, due to which people will soon get relief from the heat. The monsoon has become active in Madhya Pradesh, where a period of cloud movement is being observed. Rain was also recorded in many parts early in the morning, which caused the temperature level to drop.

Earlier, it was expected that this year the monsoon would arrive early, but it did not happen. The monsoon has entered the borders of Madhya Pradesh on time, as it has in previous years. Strong winds are also continuing in many places in the state, resulting in a drop in the temperature level. According to the Indian Meteorological Department, an alert of heavy rain with thunder has been issued in 40 districts of Madhya Pradesh.

Rain warning in these districts of MP

The Indian Meteorological Department has issued an alert for heavy rain in 40 districts of Madhya Pradesh. The IMD has issued an alert for heavy rain accompanied by thunder and lightning in Betul, Harda, Burhanpur, Khandwa, Khargone, and Barwani. Apart from these, there is a possibility of rain in Alirajpur, Jhabua, Bhopal, Vidisha, Raisen, Sehore, Rajgarh, Narmadapuram and Dhar.

A heavy rain alert has been issued for Indore, Ratlam, Ujjain, Dewas, Shajapur, Agar, Mandsaur, and Neemuch. A heavy rain warning has also been issued in Guna, Ashoknagar, Shivpuri, Gwalior, Anuppur, Shahdol, and Umaria. A heavy rain warning has also been issued in Dindori, Jabalpur, Narsinghpur, Chhindwara, Seoni, and Mandla. A heavy rain warning has also been issued in Balaghat, Damoh, Sagar, and Pandhurna.

A heat wave will prevail in these areas.

According to IMD, an orange alert has been issued for Chhatarpur, Tikamgarh, nd Niwari districts for Sunday. Apart from these, a yellow heat wave alert has been issued in Datia, Bhind, Morena and Sheopurkalan districts. Narmadapuram in the state has recorded a temperature of 45.2 degrees.

44.7 degrees have been recorded in Gwalior and Khajuraho (Chhatarpur), 44.6 degrees in Naugaon (Chhatarpur), 43.1 degrees in Satna, and 43 degrees in Sidhi. Apart from this, if we consider the minimum temperature, then the lowest recorded temperature of 17.6 degrees was in Pachmarhi (Narmadapuram).

title: Red Alert: இன்று ரெட் அலெர்ட்.. நீலகிரி மட்டுமில்லை இந்த மாவட்டங்களுக்கும் கனமழை எச்சரிக்கை.. வானிலை அப்டேட... - News18 Tamil
article_text:
Red Alert: இன்று ரெட் அலெர்ட்.. நீலகிரி மட்டுமில்லை இந்த மாவட்டங்களுக்கும் கனமழை எச்சரிக்கை.. வானிலை அப்டேட்!
Published by:
Karthi K
news18-tamil
Last Updated:
June 15, 2025 6:54 AM IST
Red Alert: நீலகிரி உள்ளிட்ட மாவட்டங்களுக்கு கனமழை எச்சரிக்கை விடப்பட்டுள்ளது.
Follow us on Google News
1/6
நீலகிரி உள்ளிட்ட மாவட்டங்களுக்கு இன்று அதிகனமழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்புள்ளதாக வானிலை மையம் ரெட் அலர்ட் வழங்கியுள்ளது.
ADVERTISEMENT
2/6
இதுகுறித்து சென்னை வானிலை ஆய்வு மையம் வெளியிட்டுள்ள அறிக்கையில், “தென்னிந்திய பகுதிகளின் மேல் வளிமண்டல மேலடுக்குச் சுழற்சி நிலவியதால் தமிழ்நாட்டில் பல்வேறு மாவட்டங்களில் மழை பெய்து வருகிறது. இந்நிலையில், நீலகிரி மாவட்டத்திற்கு நேற்று, இன்று அதி கனமழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்புள்ளதாக அந்த மாவட்டத்துக்கு ரெட் அலர்ட் எச்சரிக்கை விடப்படுகிறது. இது தவிர, நெல்லை மாவட்ட மலைப் பகுதிகள், தேனி, தென்காசி மற்றும் கன்னியாகுமரி மாவட்டங்களில் இன்று மிக கனமழை பெய்யக்கூடும் எனவும் எச்சரிக்கை விடுத்துள்ளது.
ADVERTISEMENT
3/6
தருமபுரி, ஈரோடு, சேலம், திருப்பூர் மாவட்டங்களிலும், திண்டுக்கல், மதுரை மற்றும் விருதுநகர் மாவட்டங்களில் இன்று கனமழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்புள்ளதாகவும் கூறியுள்ளது. சென்னையில் இன்று மிதமான மழை பெய்யக்கூடும். மேலும் கோவை மற்றும் நெல்லை மாவட்ட மலைப்பகுதிகளிலும், நீலகிரி, தேனி, தென்காசி மற்றும் கன்னியாகுமரி மாவட்டங்களிலும் நாளை மிக கனமழை பெய்யக்கூடும் என வானிலை ஆய்வு மையம் எச்சரிக்கை விடுத்துள்ளது.
ADVERTISEMENT
4/6
தருமபுரி, ஈரோடு, சேலம், திருப்பூர், நாமக்கல், மாவட்டங்களிலும், கரூர், திண்டுக்கல், மதுரை மற்றும் விருதுநகர் மாவட்டங்களில் நாளை கனமழை பெய்ய வாய்ப்புள்ளதாகவும் கூறியுள்ளது. தென் தமிழக கடலோரப் பகுதிகள், மன்னார் வளைகுடா மற்றும் குமரிக்கடல் பகுதிகளில் மணிக்கு 65 கிலோ மீட்டர் வேகத்தில் சூறைக்காற்று வீசக்கூடும் என்பதால், மீனவர்கள் அந்தப் பகுதிகளுக்குச் செல்ல வேண்டாம்” எனவும் வானிலை ஆய்வு மையம் அறிவுறுத்தியுள்ளது.
ADVERTISEMENT
5/6
இந்நிலையில், ரெட் அலர்ட் விடுக்கப்பட்டுள்ள நீலகிரி மாவட்டத்தில் மிதமான மழை பெய்து வரும் நிலையில், முன்னெச்சரிக்கை நடவடிக்கையாக கூடலூரில் மாநில பேரிடர் மீட்பு படையினர் முகாமிட்டுள்ளனர். உதகை, கோத்தகிரி, குன்னூர், மஞ்சூர் உள்ளிட்ட பகுதிகளில் நேற்று மிதமான மழை பெய்தது. அவலாஞ்சி அணையை ஒட்டி உள்ள கிராம பகுதிகளில் கடந்த இரண்டு வாரங்களுக்கு முன்பு பெய்த மழையால் சேதமடைந்த சாலை இன்னும் சீரமைக்கப்படாததால் வாகன ஓட்டிகள் அவதிக்கு ஆளாகியுள்ளனர்.
ADVERTISEMENT
6/6
இந்நிலையில், நீலகிரி மாவட்டத்திற்கு அதிகனமழை எச்சரிக்கை விடுக்கப்பட்டுள்ளதால், கூடலூர் மற்றும் பந்தலூரில் மாநில பேரிடர் மீட்பு படையினர் முகாமிட்டுள்ளனர். மாவட்டம் முழுவதும் 283 இடங்கள் அபாயகரமாக கண்டறியப்பட்டு முன்னெச்சரிக்கை நடவடிக்கைகள் துரிதப்படுத்தப்பட்டுள்ளன. ஆறுகள் உள்ளிட்ட நீர்நிலைகளின் அருகே யாரும் செல்ல வேண்டாம் என மாவட்ட நிர்வாகம் அறிவுறுத்தியுள்ளது.

title: Tamil Nadu weather: Red alert in Nilgiris, Chennai to receive moderate rainfall - Mathrubhumi English
article_text:
News
India
Kerala
World
Columns
More+
Tamil Nadu weather: Red alert in Nilgiris, Chennai to receive moderate rainfall
News Desk
15 June 2025, 08:14 AM IST
2 min
Share

Heavy rain warning issued for Nilgiris and other districts in Tamil Nadu. Red alert in place. Fishermen advised to stay ashore. Check affected areas.

Photo: AP

Chennai: The Chennai Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for the Nilgiris district, warning of very heavy rainfall in the region.

To advertise here, Contact Us

This alert comes amid widespread showers affecting several parts of Tamil Nadu due to prevailing atmospheric circulation over southern India.

Widespread rainfall predicted across districts

In an official bulletin, the Chennai Meteorological Centre stated that the Nilgiris is likely to receive extremely heavy rainfall on June 15, following significant precipitation yesterday.

In addition to the Nilgiris, very heavy rain has also been forecast for the hilly regions of Tirunelveli (Nellai), Theni, Tenkasi, and Kanyakumari districts.

Several other districts including Dharmapuri, Erode, Salem, Tiruppur, Dindigul, Madurai, and Virudhunagar are expected to experience heavy rainfall today. Chennai is likely to receive moderate showers.

More rainfall expected

The IMD has also forecast continued rainfall across the state on June 16. The hilly areas of Coimbatore and Tirunelveli, along with the Nilgiris, Theni, Tenkasi and Kanyakumari, are likely to be lashed by very heavy rain.

Other districts likely to experience heavy showers tomorrow include Dharmapuri, Erode, Salem, Tiruppur, Namakkal, Karur, Dindigul, Madurai, and Virudhunagar.

Fishermen advised to avoid coastal areas

The Meteorological Department has advised fishermen to refrain from venturing into the sea, particularly along the coastal areas of South Tamil Nadu, the Gulf of Mannar and the Kanyakumari Sea. Gusty winds reaching speeds of up to 65 km/h are expected in these regions.

Disaster response in the Nilgiris

Following the red alert, precautionary measures have been intensified in the Nilgiris district. The State Disaster Response Force has been stationed in Gudalur and Pandalur, and 283 vulnerable locations across the district have been identified.

Moderate rain fell yesterday in key areas of the Nilgiris including Ooty, Kotagiri, Coonoor and Manjoor. However, concerns have been raised as damage from earlier rainfall, particularly in rural areas near the Avalanche Dam, remains unrepaired, causing difficulties for motorists.

The district administration has strictly advised residents and tourists to stay away from rivers, streams, and other water bodies to avoid mishaps.

Public safety advisory

Residents in affected districts are urged to stay alert, follow local advisories, and avoid unnecessary travel during periods of intense rainfall. Emergency services are on standby, and updates will be issued as the situation develops.

title: Tamil Nadu weather update: IMD forecasts heavy rains over next 4 days; Nilgiris on high alert - News9live
article_text:
Chennai: The Tamil Nadu Weather Forecast has issued a weather alert predicting heavy to very heavy rainfall across several districts over the next three days, with the Nilgiris expected to bear the brunt of the downpour. Chennai is likely to experience moderate rainfall in isolated areas, while the Western Ghats districts continue to face relentless showers due to the active southwest monsoon.
Private meteorologist Pradeep John has warned that the Nilgiris may receive 200–300 mm of rainfall in the next 24 hours, particularly in Avalanche, Parson Valley, and Muguruthi dam regions. He further stated that Kanyakumari, Manjolai, and Valparai will also experience very heavy rainfall over the next four days, with intense showers expected in parts of Kerala and coastal Karnataka.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has indicated that an atmospheric circulation over southern India will trigger widespread rainfall. On June 15, Nilgiris is likely to witness very heavy rainfall, while Coimbatore, Tirunelveli, Theni, Tenkasi, and Kanyakumari may experience heavy showers. Moderate rainfall is expected in Erode, Salem, Tiruppur, Madurai, Dindigul, and Virudhunagar.
The intensity is expected to increase further on June 16, with Coimbatore, Tirunelveli, Nilgiris, Theni, Tenkasi, and Kanyakumari facing heavy to very heavy rainfall. Additionally, Dharmapuri, Erode, Tiruppur, Namakkal, Karur, Dindigul, Virudhunagar, and Madurai may receive heavy rains.
By June 17, the Nilgiris, Coimbatore, Tiruppur, Dindigul, Theni, and Tenkasi districts are likely to be hit by very heavy rainfall, with the downpour gradually easing by June 18.
In Chennai, the skies will remain partly cloudy on June 15, with moderate rainfall expected in areas like Ambattur, Anna Nagar, Perambur, and Manali. The city has seen uneven rainfall distribution, with northern regions recording around 150 mm since June 1, while Meenambakkam in South Chennai has received less than 10 mm.
Residents have reported thunderstorms in some parts, with daytime temperatures rising before evening showers bring relief. Over the past 24 hours, Pandalur and Avalanche in the Nilgiris recorded the highest rainfall of 7 cm.
The IMD has advised people in vulnerable areas to stay alert, as heavy rains may lead to waterlogging and disruptions in hilly and coastal regions. The weather is expected to stabilize by June 19–20, with moderate rainfall predicted across Tamil Nadu.

title: Maharashtra Weather Update: कधी होणार मुसळधार पाऊस? वाचा हवामान खात्याचा गंभीर इशारा - Krushimarathi
article_text:
हवामान
Maharashtra Weather Update: कधी होणार मुसळधार पाऊस? वाचा हवामान खात्याचा गंभीर इशारा
by Sakshi Bhosale
|
June 15, 2025

Maharashtra Weather Update:- महाराष्ट्रात सध्या पावसाळ्याचे वातावरण तयार झाले असून, हवामान विभागाने राज्यातील अनेक भागांमध्ये जोरदार ते अतिजोरदार पावसाचा इशारा दिला आहे. मागील १८ दिवसांपासून नैऋत्य मोसमी वारे (मॉन्सून) एका ठराविक सीमेत अडकले होते. २६ मे रोजी महाराष्ट्रात मॉन्सून दाखल झाला होता, मात्र त्यानंतर त्याची वाटचाल पुढे झालेली नव्हती. सध्या मात्र हवामान विभागाने दिलेल्या माहितीनुसार, मॉन्सूनच्या प्रगतीसाठी पोषक वातावरण निर्माण झाले असून, पुढील दोन दिवसांत विदर्भ आणि इतर भागात मॉन्सूनची आगेकूच होण्याची शक्यता आहे. त्यामुळे आगामी काळात संपूर्ण महाराष्ट्रात पावसाची तीव्रता वाढण्याची दाट शक्यता आहे.

राज्यातील काही जिल्ह्यांना आज रेड अलर्ट

राज्याच्या काही भागांमध्ये आधीच पावसाने हजेरी लावली आहे. हवामान खात्याने आज कोकणातील रायगड व रत्नागिरी जिल्ह्यांत एक-दोन ठिकाणी वादळी वाऱ्यासह अतिजोरदार पावसाचा इशारा दिला आहे, त्यामुळे या भागांसाठी रेड अलर्ट जारी करण्यात आला आहे. याचा अर्थ त्या भागांमध्ये अतिवृष्टी होऊ शकते आणि त्यामुळे पूर, दरड कोसळणे किंवा वाहतुकीत अडथळा निर्माण होण्यासारख्या नैसर्गिक आपत्ती उद्भवू शकतात. त्यामुळे स्थानिक प्रशासन व नागरिकांनी अत्यंत सतर्क राहण्याची आवश्यकता आहे.

काही जिल्ह्यांना पुढील तीन दिवस ऑरेंज अलर्ट

तसेच मुंबई, ठाणे, सिंधुदुर्ग, पुणे आणि कोल्हापूर जिल्ह्यांत पुढील तीन दिवस ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी करण्यात आला आहे. या अलर्टखाली येणाऱ्या भागांमध्येही जोरदार ते अतिजोरदार पावसाची शक्यता असून, शक्यतो नागरिकांनी अनावश्यक प्रवास टाळावा, नदीकाठची वस्ती असलेल्या भागात विशेष काळजी घ्यावी आणि शाळा, कार्यालय, बाजार याठिकाणी गर्दी होऊ नये याची दक्षता घ्यावी.

Maharashtra Rain: महाराष्ट्रासाठी पुढील 24 तास निर्णायक! पहा पुढील 3 दिवसाचा हवामान खात्याचा अंदाज

कोकणातील पालघर आणि मध्य महाराष्ट्रातील जळगाव, नाशिक,अहिल्यानगर, सातारा, सांगली, सोलापूर, धुळे, नंदुरबार या जिल्ह्यांमध्ये वादळी वाऱ्यांसह तुरळक ठिकाणी जोरदार पावसाचा येलो अलर्ट दिला गेला आहे. याचा अर्थ या भागांमध्ये हवामानात झपाट्याने बदल होऊन अचानक वारे, विजांच्या कडकडाटासह पाऊस होऊ शकतो. अशा परिस्थितीत नागरिकांनी वेधशाळेच्या सूचनांकडे लक्ष द्यावे.

मराठवाडा विभागातील काही जिल्ह्यांना येलो अलर्ट

मराठवाडा विभागातही छत्रपती संभाजीनगर, जालना, बीड, परभणी, हिंगोली, नांदेड, लातूर, धाराशिव या जिल्ह्यांमध्ये येलो अलर्ट लागू असून, तिथेही तुरळक ठिकाणी पावसाचा जोर दिसून येऊ शकतो. विदर्भातील अकोला, अमरावती, भंडारा, बुलढाणा, चंद्रपूर, गडचिरोली, गोंदिया, नागपूर, वर्धा, वाशिम, यवतमाळ यासारख्या जिल्ह्यांमध्येही अशाच स्वरूपाचा इशारा दिला आहे. म्हणजेच संपूर्ण महाराष्ट्रात पुढील ४८ तास अतिशय महत्त्वाचे आहेत.

हवामान खात्याच्या मते, सध्या तयार होत असलेल्या हवामान प्रणालींमुळे विदर्भासह छत्तीसगड, ओडिशा आणि गुजरात तसेच झारखंड, पश्चिम बंगाल आणि बिहार यांसारख्या राज्यांमध्येही मॉन्सूनची प्रगती होणार आहे. त्यामुळे या सर्व राज्यांमध्ये लवकरच पावसाचा जोर वाढेल आणि खरीप हंगामाची सुरुवात होण्यास मदत होईल.

title: Marathwada Rain : मराठवाड्यात सर्वदूर मुसळधार पाऊस, वादळी पावसाने केळी बागांचे नुकसान; वीज कोसळून चौघांचा मृत्यू - Maharashtra Times
article_text:
छत्रपती संभाजीनगर : मराठवाड्यात गेल्या २४ तासांत सरासरी ४९.९ मिलिमीटर पावसाची नोंद झाली आहे. धाराशिव, नांदेड आणि लातूर जिल्ह्यात सर्वाधिक पाऊस झाला आहे. ठिकठिकणी वीज अंगावर पडून चौघांचा मृत्यू झाला.


सिल्लोड तालुक्यातील सारोळा येथे यश राजू काकडे (वय १४) आणि रोहित राजू काकडे (वय २१) या भावंडांचा मृत्यू झाला. मोढा येथे शेतात अंगावर वीज पडल्याने रंजना बापूराव शिंदे (वय ५०) यांचा मृत्यू झाला. पिंपळदरी येथे शिवाजी सतीश गव्हाणे यांचा मृत्यू झाला, तर त्यांचे भाऊ जीवन सतीश गव्हाणे गंभीर जखमी झाले आहेत. कन्नड तालुक्यात तिघे जखमी झाले असून, एक बैलाचा मृत्यू झाला आहे.


हेही वाचा - Maharashtra Rain Update : मुंबईत पाऊसधारा; १८ जूनपर्यंत कोकण, मध्य महाराष्ट्रात मुसळधार ते अतिमुसळधार पावसाची शक्यता


मराठवाड्यात तीन दिवसांपासून मुसळधार

मराठवाड्यात तीन दिवसांपासून जोरदार पाऊस सुरू आहे. गेल्या २४ तासांत म्हणजेच शनिवारी सकाळी साडेआठपर्यंत धाराशिव जिल्ह्यात सर्वाधिक ७३.६ मिमी पाऊस झाला आहे. नांदेड ६१.२, लातूर ६१.१, जालना ४५.६, हिंगोली ४४.३, छत्रपती संभाजीनगर ४१.१, बीड ३८.७ आणि परभणी ३७.७ अशी जिल्हानिहाय पावसाची नोंद झाली आहे. नांदेड जिल्ह्यातील अर्धापूर तालुक्यात वादळी पावसामुळे केळीच्या बागांचे मोठे नुकसान झाले आहे. या शेतीची आमदार श्रीजया चव्हाण आणि बहुजन कल्याणमंत्री अतुल सावे यांनी शनिवारी पाहणी केली. पेरणीसाठी हा पाऊस फायदेशीर ठरला आहे.

Thane Rain Update : पावसाळ्यातील ५६ दिवस धोक्याचे, आपत्ती विभागाची महत्त्वाची माहिती; जनजीवन विस्कळीत होण्याची शक्यता

विभागात पावसाला सुरुवात झाल्यानंतर धरणात पाण्याचा ओघ सुरू झाला आहे. जायकवाडी धरणात २९.७६ टक्के पाणीसाठा झाला आहे. निम्न दुधना ३६.८८, येलदरी ५०, सिद्धेश्वर १९.५३, माजलगाव ११.७९, मांजरा २६.७२, पेनगंगा ४३.१२, मानार ४८.७४, निम्न तेरणा ७०.१८, विष्णुपुरी २३.६८ आणि सीना कोळेगाव २९.७७ असा धरणनिहाय पाणीसाठा उपलब्ध आहे, अशी माहिती जलसंपदा विभागाने दिली आहे.

कोयना धरण परिसरात तुफान पाऊस, शिंदेंचा ताफा थांबला, अखेर बोटीने दरे गावापर्यंत प्रवास!


आज वादळासह पाऊस

भारतीय हवामानशास्त्र विभागाच्या अंदाजानुसार आज, रविवारी वादळासह पावसाची शक्यता आहे. येत्या २० जूनपर्यंत मध्यम ते हलका पाऊस पडणार आहे, असा अंदाज आहे.

title: Mumbai Weather: मुंबईत मुसळधार पाऊस बरसणार, लोकल प्रवाशांचे होऊ शकतात हाल - Mumbai Tak
article_text:
Mumbai Weather: मुंबईत मुसळधार पाऊस बरसणार, लोकल प्रवाशांचे होऊ शकतात हाल
Mumbai Weather Today: 15 जून 2025 रोजी मुंबई आणि MMRDA क्षेत्रात पावसाचा जोर कायम राहण्याची शक्यता आहे, ज्यामुळे दैनंदिन जीवनावर परिणाम होऊ शकतो. नागरिकांनी हवामान अंदाजानुसार नियोजन करावे.

ADVERTISEMENT

मुंबईत मुसळधार पाऊस बरसणार (फोटो सौजन्य: Grok)
मुंबई तक
15 Jun 2025 (अपडेटेड: 15 Jun 2025, 07:33 AM)

मुंबई: भारतीय हवामान विभाग (IMD) आणि खासगी हवामान संस्थांच्या अंदाजानुसार, आज (15 जून) मुंबई आणि MMRDA परिसरात हवामान ढगाळ राहण्याची शक्यता आहे. ज्यामध्ये काही ठिकाणी जोरदार ते अतिजोरदार पावसाच्या सरी कोसळण्याचा अंदाज आहे. मान्सूनच्या सक्रियतेमुळे कोकण किनारपट्टीसह मुंबई, ठाणे, नवी मुंबई, पालघर या भागांत पावसाचा जोर वाढण्याची शक्यता वर्तवण्यात आली आहे.

हवामानाचा तपशील

पाऊस: मुंबई शहर आणि उपनगरांमध्ये सकाळपासूनच आकाश पूर्णपणे ढगाळ राहील. दुपारनंतर आणि संध्याकाळी काही भागांत विजांच्या कडकडाटासह मुसळधार पावसाची शक्यता आहे. पावसाचे प्रमाण 20 ते 50 मिमी दरम्यान असण्याची अपेक्षा आहे, परंतु काही ठिकाणी 100 मिमी पेक्षा जास्त पाऊस नोंदवला जाऊ शकतो. ठाणे, नवी मुंबई आणि कल्याण-डोंबिवली यांसारख्या MMRDA क्षेत्रातही मध्यम ते जोरदार पावसाचा अंदाज आहे.

हे ही वाचा>> मुंबईची खबर: Veg आणि Non Veg एकाच किचनमध्ये बनवणाऱ्या हॉटेल मालकांची लागणार वाट!

वारे: दक्षिण-पश्चिम दिशेकडून 15 ते 30 किमी प्रतितास वेगाने वारे वाहतील, काही ठिकाणी वादळी वाऱ्यांचा वेग 40 किमी प्रतितासपर्यंत पोहोचू शकतो.

भरती-ओहोटी: 15 जून रोजी पहाटे 1.53 वाजता 3.64 मीटर उंचीची भरती अपेक्षित आहे, तर सकाळी 7.39 वाजता ओहोटी होईल. या भरतीमुळे किनारपट्टीच्या कमी उंचीच्या भागात पाणी साचण्याची शक्यता आहे, विशेषतः पावसाचा जोर वाढल्यास.

MMRDA क्षेत्रासाठी विशेष अंदाज

ठाणे आणि नवी मुंबई: या भागांत सकाळी हलक्या सरींसह ढगाळ वातावरण असेल, परंतु दुपारनंतर पावसाचा जोर वाढेल. ठाण्यात काही ठिकाणी विजांच्या कडकडाटासह 30 ते 40 मिमी पाऊस पडण्याची शक्यता आहे. नवी मुंबईतही तुरळक ठिकाणी मुसळधार पावसाचा इशारा देण्यात आला आहे.

हे ही वाचा>> Air India Plane Crash: रोशनी सोनघरेची इंस्टाग्रामवरची शेवटची पोस्ट अन्...

पालघर: कोकण किनारपट्टीवरील या भागांत पावसाचा जोर अधिक असेल. पालघरमध्ये मध्यम ते जोरदार पाऊस तर काही ठिकाणी अतिमुसळधार पावसाची शक्यता आहे.

कल्याण-डोंबिवली आणि उल्हासनगर: या भागांत पावसाच्या हलक्या ते मध्यम सरींसह ढगाळ वातावरण राहील. संध्याकाळी पावसाचा जोर वाढण्याची शक्यता आहे.

वाहतूक

मुसळधार पावसामुळे मुंबईतील रस्ते वाहतूक आणि लोकल ट्रेनच्या वेळापत्रकावर परिणाम होऊ शकतो. कमी उंचीच्या भागांत पाणी साचण्याची शक्यता आहे, विशेषतः चर्चगेट, परळ, सायन, आणि अंधेरीसारख्या ठिकाणी.

हवामान खात्याचा इशारा

IMD ने मुंबई आणि MMRDA क्षेत्रासाठी यलो ते ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी केला आहे, ज्यामुळे स्थानिक प्रशासन आणि नागरिकांना सतर्क राहण्याचे आवाहन करण्यात आले आहे. “13 ते 16 जून दरम्यान मान्सूनच्या सक्रियतेमुळे कोकण आणि मध्य महाराष्ट्रात मुसळधार पावसाची शक्यता आहे. नागरिकांनी खबरदारी घ्यावी,” असे पुणे वेधशाळेच्या प्रमुखांनी सांगितले.

हे वाचलं का?

title: Maharashtra Rain Alert: राज्यात ‘या’ जिल्ह्यात आज होणार अतिमुसळधार पाऊस! हवामान विभागाचा रेड अलर्ट - Krushimarathi
article_text:
हवामान
Maharashtra Rain Alert: राज्यात ‘या’ जिल्ह्यात आज होणार अतिमुसळधार पाऊस! हवामान विभागाचा रेड अलर्ट
by Sakshi Bhosale
|
June 15, 2025

Maharashtra Rain Alert:- महाराष्ट्रात पावसाने जोरदार हजेरी लावली असून, अनेक भागांमध्ये पावसाचा जोर दिवसेंदिवस वाढत आहे. विशेषतः कोकण, घाटमाथा आणि मध्य महाराष्ट्रातील अनेक जिल्ह्यांमध्ये मोठ्या प्रमाणावर पावसाची नोंद झाली आहे. आज दिनांक १५ जून रोजी हवामान विभागाने रत्नागिरी जिल्ह्यासाठी मुसळधार पावसाचा रेड अलर्ट जारी केला आहे. याचा अर्थ, त्या भागात अतिवृष्टी होण्याची शक्यता असून स्थानिक प्रशासन व नागरिकांनी विशेष सतर्क राहण्याची आवश्यकता आहे.

कोकणातील इतर भाग आणि पश्चिम घाटाच्या अनेक ठिकाणी ऑरेंज अलर्ट जाहीर करण्यात आला आहे, म्हणजेच त्या भागातही जोरदार पावसाचा इशारा आहे. उर्वरित महाराष्ट्रात विजांच्या कडकडाटासह वादळी वाऱ्यांसह पावसाचा येलो अलर्ट देण्यात आला आहे, ज्यामुळे सामान्य नागरिकांनी आवश्यक खबरदारी घ्यावी, असे आवाहन हवामान विभागाने केले आहे.

राज्यातील हवामान बदलामागील कारणे

राज्यभरातील हवामानातील या बदलांमागे अनेक वातावरणीय कारणे आहेत. सध्या राजस्थानच्या भागात चक्राकार वाऱ्यांचे व्यवस्थापन तयार झाले असून त्याचा परिणाम म्हणून गुजरातपासून उत्तर-मध्य महाराष्ट्रापर्यंत कमी दाबाचा पट्टा सक्रिय झाला आहे. यासोबतच उत्तर कर्नाटक आणि मराठवाड्याच्या भागातही चक्राकार वाऱ्यांची स्थिती निर्माण झाली आहे. यामुळे संपूर्ण महाराष्ट्रात पावसाला पोषक वातावरण तयार झाले आहे. अरबी समुद्रापासून आंध्र प्रदेशाच्या किनाऱ्यापर्यंत एक कमी दाबाचा पट्टा निर्माण झाला असून, त्यामुळे कोकण, घाटमाथा आणि इतर भागांत पावसाची तीव्रता वाढण्याची शक्यता आहे.

Maharashtra Rain: महाराष्ट्रासाठी पुढील 24 तास निर्णायक! पहा पुढील 3 दिवसाचा हवामान खात्याचा अंदाज

शुक्रवारची पावसाची परिस्थिती कशी होती?

शुक्रवारी म्हणजेच १४ जून रोजी कोकणातील अनेक ठिकाणी मोठ्या प्रमाणावर पाऊस पडल्याचे नोंद झाली. सिंधुदुर्ग जिल्ह्यातील रामेश्वर (कृषी केंद्र) येथे तब्बल ३०० मिमी पाऊस झाला, तर देवगड येथे २२० मिमी आणि वैभववाडी येथे ११० मिमी पावसाची नोंद झाली. दुसरीकडे, धुळे शहरात ४० अंश सेल्सिअस तापमानाची नोंद झाली, जे राज्यातील त्या दिवशीचे सर्वाधिक तापमान होते. हे दाखवते की, राज्यात काही ठिकाणी पावसामुळे तापमान कमी झाले असले तरी काही भागात उष्णतेची तीव्रता अद्याप कायम आहे.

पावसाच्या या स्थितीत सर्वसामान्य नागरिकांनी सावधगिरी बाळगण्याची गरज आहे. घाटमाथ्याच्या भागांमध्ये दरडी कोसळण्याचा धोका, नद्यांना पूर येण्याची शक्यता आणि जलप्रवाहात अचानक वाढ होण्याचा धोका संभवतो. त्यामुळे नागरिकांनी प्रशासनाच्या सूचना पाळाव्यात. पावसाच्या दरम्यान अनावश्यक प्रवास टाळावा, वाहतुकीस अडथळा होऊ शकतो याची कल्पना ठेवावी. शेतीकामांमध्येही सतर्कता ठेवण्याची गरज आहे, कारण जोरदार पावसामुळे शेतांमध्ये पाणी साचू शकते व त्यामुळे पिकांचे नुकसान होण्याची शक्यता आहे.

सध्या मॉन्सूनची प्रगती कशी?

एकीकडे पावसाची हजेरी लागली असली तरी दुसरीकडे मॉन्सूनची प्रगती काहीशी संथ झाल्याचे दिसून येते. महाराष्ट्रातील काही भागांमध्ये मॉन्सून पोहोचला आहे. मुंबई, अहिल्यानगर, बीड, परभणी, हिंगोली, नांदेड, यवतमाळ, चंद्रपूर आणि गडचिरोली जिल्ह्यांत नैऋत्य मोसमी वारे (मॉन्सून) दाखल झाले आहेत. मात्र, गेल्या २० दिवसांपासून मॉन्सूनची पुढील वाटचाल ठप्प झाली असून, त्यात कोणताही बदल झालेला नाही. हवामान विभागाच्या अंदाजानुसार, पुढील दोन ते तीन दिवसांत विदर्भासह छत्तीसगड, ओडिशा, पश्चिम बंगाल, झारखंड, बिहार आणि गुजरातमध्ये मॉन्सूनचा प्रवेश होण्याची शक्यता आहे. त्यामुळे या भागांमध्येही लवकरच पावसाची सुरुवात होईल, अशी अपेक्षा आहे.

Heavy rains lash Mumbai; 'yellow' alert for city, 'orange' for neighbouring districts
The weather dept sounded a 'yellow' alert for Mumbai, forecasting heavy showers at isolated places, and an 'orange' alert for neighbouring Thane, Raigad and Palghar districts
Agencies
15 Jun 2025 10:48 AM IST  (Updated:2025-06-15 05:18:53)

Mumbai, Jun 15 (PTI) Parts of Mumbai received heavy rainfall overnight and the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Sunday predicted more showers at isolated places in the city and suburbs, civic officials said.

The weather department sounded a 'yellow' alert for Mumbai, forecasting heavy showers at isolated places, and an 'orange' alert for neighbouring Thane, Raigad and Palghar districts, which are expected to receive heavy to very heavy rainfall.

Parts of Mumbai witnessed heavy showers overnight along with thunder and lightning. The rains eased by morning, with only light showers, and no major waterlogging was reported.

In the 24-hour period ending at 8 am on Sunday, the island city received 31 mm rainfall, while the eastern and western suburbs recorded 21 mm and 20 mm rainfall, respectively, as per the civic officials.

A high tide of 4.27 metres is expected at 2.52 pm on Sunday and a low tide of 1.91 metres at 8.55 pm.

On Monday, there is forecast of a high tide of 3.55 metres at 2.37 am and a low tide of 1.06 metres at 8.20 am, the officials said. PTI

(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by The Federal staff and is auto-published from a syndicated feed.)

Met Office forecast relief in heatwave with pre-monsoon rains
By
Web Desk
| June 14, 2025
 Share

InternationalJune 14, 2025
Israel’s attacks on Iran hint at a bigger ambition: regime change
InternationalJune 14, 2025
Iran ‘does not seek’ nuclear weapons, Iran President tells Putin
Web Desk
News Stories Posted by ARY News Digital Team

ISLAMABAD: Severe heatwave conditions are likely to subside during the rainfall and dust storms predicted by the Met Office in the country.

The Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) has forecast the arrival of a pre-monsoon weather system set to impact eastern parts of Sindh starting from Saturday evening.

According to the PMD, scattered rain accompanied by gusty winds and thunderstorms are expected such as Tharparkar and Umerkot.

On Sunday, similar weather conditions including strong winds and rainfall in some places likely in Ghotki, Sukkur, Khairpur, Jacobabad, Shikarpur, Mithi, Badin, Mirpur Khas, Umarkot, Thatta, Karachi and Hyderabad districts.

Earlier, Met Office predicted that moist currents are penetrating in upper parts of the country, and a westerly wave is also likely to approach on 13th June.

Duststorm/rainfall and isolated hailstorm expected in Kashmir, Gilgit Baltistan, Murree, Galliyat, and various districts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa from 13th to 16th June.

Rainfall also expected in Islamabad, Rawalpindi and districts of upper and central Punjab including Lahore and Balochistan’s Zhob, Barkhan and Musakhel up to 16th June.

Dust storm/thunder-rain is also expected in all the districts of southern Punjab during the period.

title: ALERT: నేడు ఈ ప్రాంతాల్లో భారీ వర్షం.. ఉరుములు మెరుపులతో ఈదురుగాలులు - RTV Telugu
article_text:
ALERT: నేడు ఈ ప్రాంతాల్లో భారీ వర్షం.. ఉరుములు మెరుపులతో ఈదురుగాలులు

నేడు తెలంగాణలోని పలు జిల్లాల్లో భారీ వర్షం కురవనుంది. రంగారెడ్డి, ఉమ్మడి మహబూబ్‌నగర్ జిల్లాలో ఈదురుగాలులతో పాటు మోస్తరు నుంచి భారీ వర్షాలు కురిసే అవకాశం ఉందని వాతవరణ నిపుణులు హెచ్చరించారు.

By K Mohan  15 Jun 2025 | నవీకరించబడింది పై 15 Jun 2025 08:01 IST in తెలంగాణ SHORT NEWS

Heavy rains in Telangana.

రానున్న మూడు రోజులు తెలంగాణలోని పలు జిల్లాల్లో భారీ వర్షాలు కురుస్తాయన హైదరాబాద్ వాతావరణ కేంద్ర హెచ్చరించింది. జూన్ 17 వరకు రాష్ట్రంలోని పలు ప్రాంతాల్లో వర్షాలు కొనసాగనున్నాయని వాతావరణ శాఖ అధికారులు అప్రమత్తం చేశారు. ముఖ్యంగా ఉమ్మడి ఆదిలాబాద్, నిజామాబాద్, మెదక్, రంగారెడ్డి, మహబూబ్‌నగర్, నల్లగొండ జిల్లాల్లోని చాలా ప్రాంతాల్లో భారీ వర్షాలు కురుస్తాయని అంచనా. ఈ మేరకు ఆయా జిల్లాలకు ఎల్లో అలర్ట్ జారీ చేశారు. ఈ సమయంలో గాలి వేగం గంటకు 40 నుండి 50 కిలోమీటర్ల వరకు ఉంటుందని వాతావరణ శాఖ తెలిపింది. వర్షం కురిసే సమయంలో ప్రజలు ఇళ్ల నుంచి బయటకు వెళ్లొద్దని సూచించారు.

ఎల్లో అలర్ట్

భారీ వర్షాల నేపథ్యంలో ఉమ్మడి ఆదిలాబాద్, నిజామాబాద్, మెదక్, రంగారెడ్డి, మహబూబ్‌నగర్, నల్లగొండ జిల్లాలకు వాతావరణ శాఖ ఎల్లో అలర్ట్ జారీ చేసింది. ఈ ప్రాంతాల్లో తేలికపాటి నుంచి మోస్తరు వర్షాలు కురవనున్నాయని, గంటకు 40–50 కిలోమీటర్ల వేగంతో గాలులు వీస్తాయని హెచ్చరించింది. 

అటు ఢిల్లీలో కూడా ఆదివారం రాత్రి వర్షం కురవడం మొదలైంది. భారత వాతావరణ శాఖ (IMD) ప్రకారం.. తెల్లవారుజామున ఢిల్లీలో భారీ వర్షం, తుఫానులు సంభవించింది. గాలి వేగం గంటకు 50 నుంచి 104 కి.మీ.ల మధ్య ఉంది. ఇది నిన్న మొన్న ఎండ తీవ్రతల నుంచి ప్రజలకు నుండి ఉపశమనం కలిగించింది. ఈ వర్షం ఢిల్లీ అంతటా ఉష్ణోగ్రతలలో గణనీయమైన తగ్గుదలకు దారితీసింది.

title: जम्मू-कश्मीर में प्रचंड गर्मी से मिलेगी राहत, कल से झमाझम बारिश के आसार; पढ़ें मौसम का लेटेस्ट अपडेट - Jammu and Kashmir will get relief from the scorching heat heavy rains are expected from tomorrow Read the latest we - Jagran
article_text:
जम्मू-कश्मीर में प्रचंड गर्मी से मिलेगी राहत, कल से झमाझम बारिश के आसार; पढ़ें मौसम का लेटेस्ट अपडेट

जम्मू संभाग में धूल भरी आंधी और हल्की बारिश के बावजूद गर्मी से राहत नहीं मिली। तापमान सामान्य से ऊपर रहा और लू का प्रकोप जारी रहा। मौसम विभाग के अनुसार कल से तापमान में कुछ गिरावट की संभावना है लेकिन यह सामान्य से ऊपर ही रहेगा। 16-17 जून को मौसम शुष्क रहेगा जबकि 18-19 जून को भी ज्यादातर क्षेत्रों में मौसम शुष्क रहने की संभावना है।

BY DIGITAL DESK
EDITED BY: NITISH KUMAR KUSHWAHA
UPDATED: SUN, 15 JUN 2025 07:30 AM (IST)
जम्मू-कश्मीर में कल से बारिश के आसार हैं। फाइल फोटो
जागरण संवाददाता, जम्मू। जम्मू संभाग के कुछ स्थानों पर धूल भरी आंधी के साथ हल्की बारिश के बावजूद शनिवार का प्रचंड गर्मी से राहत नहीं मिली। बेशक अधिकतम तापमान में एक से दो डिग्री सेल्सियस तक गिरावट दर्ज की गई। उसके बावजूद जम्मू-कश्मीर के सभी क्षेत्रों में तापमान सामान्य से ऊपर ही चल रहा है।

दिन में लू का प्रकोप बना हुआ है। तपती गर्मी के बीच घरों से निकलना मुश्किल है। आर्द्रता के स्तर में सुबह और शाम के बीच बड़ा अंतर देखा गया। मौसम विज्ञान केंद्र, श्रीनगर के अनुसार कल से तापमान में कुछ डिग्री की गिरावट आने की संभावना है, जिससे गर्मी से थोड़ी राहत मिलेगी। हालांकि, तापमान सामान्य से कुछ डिग्री ऊपर बना रह सकता है।

16-17 जून को अधिकतर इलाकों में मौसम शुष्क रहेगा। जम्मू क्षेत्र में कहीं-कहीं वर्षा की संभावना है। जबकि 18-19 जून को ज्यादातर क्षेत्रों में मौसम शुष्क रहने की संभावना है। एक-दो स्थानों पर हल्की बारिश की संभावना से इनकार नहीं किया जा सकता। शनिवार को जम्मू का अधिकतम तापमान 41.0 डिग्री सेल्सियस दर्ज किया गया। जबकि सामान्य तापमान 38.8 डिग्री है।

विज्ञापन हटाएं
सिर्फ ₹3 में
न्यूनतम तापमान 27.9 डिग्री सेल्सियस। बनिहाल का अधिकतम तापमान 32.0 डिग्री दर्ज किया। न्यूनतम तापमान 17.0 डिग्री सेल्सियस रह। बटोत का अधिकतम तापमान 30.6, न्यूनतम तापमान 16.1 डिग्री दर्ज किया गया। कटड़ा का अधिकतम तापमान 38.4 डिग्री और न्यूनतम तापमान 24.0 डिग्री रहा।

जबकि भद्रवाह का अधिकतम तापमान 31.6 डिग्री सेल्सियस रहा। श्रीनगर का अधिकतम तापमान 30.3 डिग्री, काजीगुंड का अधिकतम तापमान 29.3 डिग्री, न्यूनतम तापमान 17.6 डिग्री रहा। पहलगाम का अधिकतम तापमान 25.8 डिग्री, गुलमर्ग का अधिकतम तापमान 20.5 जबकि न्यूनतम तापमान 10.6 डिग्री सेल्सियस रहा।

title: Delhi NCR Rain Alert : दिल्ली-एनसीआर में अगले 2 घंटे में भारी बारिश, रेड अलर्ट जारी, इस दिन तक लगातार बरसें... - News18 Hindi
article_text:
Delhi NCR Rain Alert : दिल्ली-एनसीआर में अगले 2 घंटे में भारी बारिश, रेड अलर्ट जारी, इस दिन तक लगातार बरसेंगे बादल
Reported by:
Anjali Singh
Edited by:
Lalit Bhatt
Agency:
NEWS18DELHI
Last Updated:
June 15, 2025, 06:51 IST
Delhi- NCR Ka Mausam: दिल्ली एनसीआर में देर रात 80-100 किमी/घंटा की रफ्तार से तूफान और बारिश ने गर्मी से राहत दी. आज अगले दो घंटे में दिल्ली-एनसीआर में बारिश की संभावना है. जिसको लेकर रेड अलर्ट जारी किया है. आग...और पढ़ें
इम्पैक्ट शॉर्ट्स
सबसे बड़ी खबरों तक पहुंचने का आपका शॉर्टकट
गूगल न्यूज पर हमें फॉलो करें

नई दिल्ली/अंजलि सिंह राजपूत : दिल्ली एनसीआर में गर्मी से तड़पते हुए लोगों के लिए देर रात बारिश राहत बनकर बरसी. रात करीब 3:00 बजे से लेकर 4:30 तक पूरे दिल्ली एनसीआर में 80 से 100 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तूफान आया. इस तूफान के साथ ही बारिश का सिलसिला शुरू हुआ. इस दौरान दिल्ली के कई हिस्सों में ओले भी गिरे हैं. नोएडा, गाजियाबाद, गुड़गांव, फरीदाबाद, ग्रेटर नोएडा समेत पूरे दिल्ली-NCR में हल्की बारिश और तूफान ने मौसम को ठंडा कर दिया है.

अभी तक आग की भट्टी बन चुका था दिल्ली एनसीआर, लेकिन अब मौसम सुहावना हो गया है. रविवार की सुबह ठंडे मौसम के साथ हुई है. यही नहीं आज हीटवेव का अलर्ट हट गया है और सबसे बड़ी राहत यह है कि  बारिश की वजह से तापमान 45 डिग्री सेल्सियस से गिरकर 39 डिग्री सेल्सियस पर आ गया है. भारत मौसम विज्ञान विभाग की ओर से दी गई जानकारी के मुताबिक दिल्ली के प्रगति मैदान में 67 और दिल्ली के पालम में 80 से 100 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से हवाएं रिकॉर्ड हुई हैं, जबकि सफदरजंग में 33 मिलीमीटर, लोधी रोड पर 32 मिलीमीटर और पूसा में 27 मिमी बारिश रिकार्ड की गई है. आज अगले दो घंटे में पूरे दिल्ली एनसीआर में भारी बारिश हो सकती है.  जिसको लेकर आईएमडी ने रेड अलर्ट जारी किया है.

20 जून तक होगी झमाझम बारिश 
आपको बता दें कि पूरा दिल्ली एनसीआर गर्मी से तड़प रहा था. तापमान 45 डिग्री सेल्सियस पहुंच गया था. धूप की तपिश इतनी तेज थी कि गर्मी 50 से 55 डिग्री सेल्सियस महसूस हो रही थी. हीट इंडेक्स भी 50 के करीब ही रिकॉर्ड किया जा रहा था, लेकिन फिलहाल यह बारिश राहत बनकर दिल्ली एनसीआर के लोगों के ऊपर बरसी है. भारत मौसम विज्ञान विभाग के वरिष्ठ मौसम वैज्ञानिक डॉ. आरके जेनामणि की ओर से दी गई जानकारी के मुताबिक फिलहाल 20 जून तक अभी बारिश होती रहेगी. आज 15 जून है यानी 15 जून से लेकर अगले पांच दिनों तक यूं ही बारिश होती रहेगी. बादलों की आवाजाही लगी रहेगी. तापमान भी गिरकर 36 डिग्री सेल्सियस पर आने का पूर्वानुमान है. कहा जा सकता है कि अगले पांच दिन दिल्ली एनसीआर के लोगों के लिए राहत भरे रहेंगे.

title: Rainfall, Thunderstorm, Winds Bring Respite From Heatwave In Delhi - NDTV
article_text:
Rainfall, Thunderstorm, Winds Bring Respite From Heatwave In Delhi
The India Meteorological Department has predicted a severe thunderstorm and strong wind for the city, warning residents in Delhi-NCR to stay indoors.
Indo-Asian News Service
India News
Jun 15, 2025 07:44 am IST
Published On
Jun 15, 2025 06:49 am IST
Last Updated On
Jun 15, 2025 07:44 am IST
Read Time:
4 mins
Share
Twitter
WhatsApp
Facebook
Reddit
Email
Southwest monsoon expected to reach Delhi between June 19 and 25. (File)
Show
Quick Read
Summary is AI-generated, newsroom-reviewed
New Delhi:

After prolonged spell of scorching temperatures for several days, people in the national capital received a gradual respite from heatwave conditions early Sunday, as several parts of the city experienced light rainfall thunderstorm and strong winds.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a severe thunderstorm and strong wind for the city, warning residents in Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR) to stay indoors.

According to the IMD, "moderate to intense spell of rainfall with thunderstorms and lightning, and squally winds reaching speeds of 80-100 kmph" swept through the capital during the early Sunday hours.

Two thundersqualls along with hailstorm activity were recorded at Safdarjung between 0348 to 0350 hrs IST and 0358 to 0400 hrs IST.

The first squall saw gusty winds reaching 82 kmph, while the second saw a peak wind speed of 104 kmph, the IMD said.

The weather department urged residents to take precautions.

"Stay indoors and avoid travel unless necessary," the IMD advisory said, as flying debris and low visibility posed risks on the roads.

The Safdarjung observatory, Delhi's official weather station, recorded a maximum temperature of 41.2 degrees Celsius on Friday -- a dip of 2.7 degrees from Thursday, but still 1.3 degrees Celsius above normal. The minimum temperature remained high at 31.0 degrees Celsius, marking a departure of 3 degrees Celsius from the seasonal average. Humidity levels oscillated between 51 per cent and 69 per cent, making conditions hot and uncomfortable throughout the day.

According to IMD officials, the national capital is set to witness generally cloudy skies with very light to moderate rainfall, thunderstorms, dust storms, and lightning till June 19. Gusty winds are also expected during thunderstorms.

This comes after a red alert - a severe warning level - was issued for Delhi, as the capital experienced extreme heatwave conditions. Daytime temperatures climbed to between 41°C and 45°C, while the minimum temperature reached 31°C, marking a rise of four degrees above the seasonal average.

The weather department has predicted partly cloudy skies with a chance of a thunderstorm and rain early Sunday morning, potentially bringing some relief from the intense heat.

The IMD, in its extended range forecast, has said that the southwest monsoon is likely to advance over the remaining parts of central and eastern India, along with some areas in northwest India, between June 12 and 18. It is further expected to reach most parts of northwest India, including Delhi, between June 19 and 25.

The normal date for the monsoon to arrive in Delhi is around June 30.

This year, it arrived in Kerala on May 24 -- well ahead of the usual onset date of 1 June -- and reached Mumbai by May 26, which is 16 days earlier than normal.

According to IMD data, the monsoon reached Delhi on June 28 last year, and on June 26 in 2023.

In previous years, it arrived on June 30 (2022), July 13 (2021), and June 25 (2020).

After a nearly 10-day pause, the monsoon has picked up pace again, especially over southern India.

Since Wednesday, several parts of Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Konkan, and Maharashtra have been receiving heavy to very heavy rainfall. This renewed activity marks a strong push northwards, indicating rapid progress of the monsoon across the country.

The IMD has also said the second phase of the monsoon is expected to spread across eastern India, bringing rainfall to West Bengal, Odisha, Bihar, Jharkhand, and eastern Uttar Pradesh within the next week.

--IANS

title: Delhi weather: City cools after 45°C heat as IMD predicts monsoon between June 19–25 - Business Today
article_text:
Delhi saw pre-dawn thunderstorms, gusting winds crossing 100 kmph, and heavy rain on Sunday, offering a dramatic but welcome break from a relentless heatwave.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a severe thunderstorm alert for the capital as wind speeds surged to 104 kmph at Safdarjung during two brief thundersqualls around 4 a.m. The downpour, accompanied by lightning and gusty winds, flooded roads, disrupted traffic, and cooled a city that had been reeling under temperatures exceeding 45°C.
“The thunderstorm was intense, with winds reaching 80–100 kmph,” IMD officials said, urging residents to remain indoors. Areas like Krishi Bhavan and Rafi Marg reported significant rainfall, while early commuters faced delays due to waterlogging in low-lying zones.
Just days earlier, the capital had recorded blistering highs—Ayanagar hit 45.0°C, with Palam and Ridge not far behind. But the IMD now forecasts a shift, with no heatwave warnings for the week ahead. Daytime temperatures are expected to hover between 35°C and 41°C, while rain and cloudy skies bring intermittent relief.
The IMD also predicts the early onset of the southwest monsoon between June 19 and 25, nearly 10 days ahead of schedule. This could mean more sustained rain and a reprieve from both the heat and high humidity.
Despite the cooling effect, the storm came with its risks. “Avoid travel unless necessary,” the IMD advisory read, highlighting the danger from flying debris and poor visibility during the squalls.
As Delhi transitions from extreme heat to pre-monsoon turbulence, residents are advised to stay alert and prepare for more weather swings in the days ahead.

title: Delhi works on flood control ahead of monsoon - The Sunday Guardian Live
article_text:
Delhi works on flood control ahead of monsoon
NewsDelhi works on flood control ahead of monsoon
By
Tikam Sharma
June 15, 2025

The BJP government has ramped up flood control efforts with advanced monitoring ahead of monsoon in Delhi

NEW DELHI: The newly established Bharatiya Janata Party-led government in Delhi has gone into active mode, working effectively to prepare the capital for the upcoming monsoon season. Every year, heavy rains disrupt daily life in the national capital, leading to widespread waterlogging that hampers the city’s functioning and causes severe inconvenience to its residents.

Tragically, last year’s monsoon even claimed several lives due to flooding-related incidents. Determined to avoid a repeat of such scenarios, the new administration has acted swiftly and decisively to get Delhi monsoon-ready. As part of these proactive measures, Delhi’s Minister of Irrigation and Flood Control, Parvesh Sahib Singh, conducted an inspection of the modern control room of the Irrigation and Flood Control (I&FC) Department located in Shastri Nagar. This visit was part of a broader high-level review of the city’s flood preparedness and drainage system readiness ahead of the monsoon.

While addressing the media during his visit, the Minister emphasised that the government has adopted a war-footing approach to flood control efforts. “This is our I&FC Control Room, which continuously monitors all 77 major drains across Delhi and keeps track of the water level of the Yamuna River around the clock. It analyses rainfall drainage flow, the volume of water released upstream, and the downstream consequences,” he stated. Singh further added that the control room will remain fully functional 24 hours a day, seven days a week, throughout the entire monsoon period. It will serve as the central hub for real-time coordination and emergency decision-making.

Starting June 15, when monsoon activity is expected to intensify, the control room will also host officials from the police, SDM offices, and other crucial departments to ensure prompt and collaborative responses during flood-related emergencies. During the review session, senior departmental officials briefed the Minister that nearly 90% of the cleaning work for the city’s 76 major drains has already been completed. The remaining portion is undergoing final clean-up operations. Advanced machinery, GPS tracking tools, and on-site inspection teams are being used to ensure that no clogs occur, thus significantly reducing the threat of water accumulation and flooding in the city.

The Minister directed that daily, real-time progress reports on the drain-cleaning operations be updated and maintained in the control room without fail. He also carefully examined the surveillance setup, warning systems, and multi-agency coordination protocols at the facility to ensure the systems are fully prepared to handle emergencies. Reinforcing the government’s commitment, the Minister remarked, “Our objective is not just to manage heavy rainfall but to rebuild the trust of the people of Delhi that this year, the situation will be different. We are not limiting our efforts to plans on paper— work is actively happening on the ground. Citizens will witness the change.

This is not merely a promise, but a firm commitment.” The I&FC Department has also operationalised live monitoring systems and alert mechanisms to guarantee a quick and efficient response in case of emergency situations, with a particular focus on the prompt evacuation of low-lying and floodprone areas, if necessary. Given the extensive waterlogging and urban flooding experienced in recent monsoons, this comprehensive, all-hands-on-deck strategy represents a significant departure from past practices. It reflects the government’s shift towards a more technologically equipped, datadriven model of governance in managing Delhi’s drainage and flood-control infrastructure.

title: After weeks of unbearable heat, Delhi dances in rain; IMD predicts monsoon between June 19–25 - WION
article_text:
The India Meteorological Department has issued a severe thunderstorm alert for the capital as wind speeds surged to 104 kmph at Safdarjung during two brief thundersqualls around 4am.
After days of unbearable heat, Delhi finally received a much-needed breather as pre-monsoon showers swept across the capital and surrounding NCR regions. The city, which had been reeling under a heatwave with temperatures soaring past 45°C, experienced rainfall accompanied by gusty winds and thunderstorms, offering significant relief to residents.
The IMD has predicted that this spell of pre-monsoon activity will continue intermittently over the next few days, with further thunderstorms, light to moderate rain, and strong surface winds expected. The much-awaited southwest monsoon is likely to reach Delhi between June 19 and June 25, slightly ahead of its usual schedule.
Heavy rain accompanied by strong winds lashed the national capital last night, bringing respite from the heat

(Source: ANI) pic.twitter.com/5qBXA5RE9p
According to the IMD, a “moderate to intense spell of rainfall with thunderstorms and lightning, and squally winds reaching speeds of 80-100 kmph” passed through Delhi in the early hours.
Meanwhile, the weather department also urged residents to take precautions. "Stay indoors and avoid travel unless necessary," the IMD advisory said, as flying debris and low visibility posed risks on the roads.
Earlier, the IMD has issued a red alert, warning residents of severe health risks and advising caution for outdoor activities.
A heat wave is defined as a long period of excessively hot weather, usually accompanied by humidity. Heat waves can pose health risks, and put a strain on infrastructure, particularly due to high electricity consumption for cooling.
Heat waves are declared when temperatures exceed the average for a specific region.
Geologically, heat waves are caused by a combination of intense sunlight, high-pressure systems that trap warm air and lead to hot winds, reduced cloud cover, and lack of cooling breezes.

Heat waves typically last for days, but can extend to weeks. Heatstroke, dehydration are among health risks associated with heat waves, which are typically accompanied by power outages due to a rise in cooling demand.

title: Rain Brings Relief To Delhi-NCR After Scorching Heatwave; IMD Issues Storm Advisory - Live India
article_text:
- Advertisement -

Heavy showers, thunderstorms, and squally winds lash Delhi and adjoining regions, easing intense heat but prompting IMD to advise residents to stay indoors due to 80-100 kmph wind gusts.

New Delhi, June 15, 2025:

Residents of Delhi-NCR woke up to a welcome burst of heavy rainfall, thunderstorms, and strong winds on Sunday morning after days of persistent heatwave conditions. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) confirmed that the fresh spell of rain brought temporary relief to Delhi, Noida, Gurugram, and other surrounding areas reeling under scorching temperatures for nearly a week.

Also Read: U.S. Army’s 250th Anniversary Concludes with Fireworks, Parade, and Protests Amid Trump Birthday Celebration-Photos

The IMD, however, has issued a safety advisory, urging residents to stay indoors and avoid non-essential travel. Posting on X (formerly Twitter), the department stated:

“Moderate to intense spell of rainfall with thunderstorms and lightning, squally winds 80–100 kmph is going on over Delhi and NCR. Stay indoors and avoid travel unless necessary.”

Over the past few days, Delhi had witnessed a severe heatwave, with temperatures consistently breaching the 43°C mark. On Friday, there was a marginal dip in temperature, with Safdarjung Observatory recording a maximum of 41.2°C, still 1.3°C above normal, as per PTI. Despite the slight temperature drop, high humidity levels — ranging between 51% and 69% — had kept discomfort levels elevated.

- Advertisement -

Also Read: ‘What I Saw Scared Me’: Teen Who Captured Ahmedabad Plane Crash Video Shares What Prompted Him to Record it

Sunday’s rainfall and gusty winds not only brought down the temperature but also offered temporary atmospheric cleansing. However, Delhi’s Air Quality Index (AQI) remained in the ‘moderate’ category, with a reading of 195 at 9 am, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB). For reference, AQI levels between 101 and 200 are considered ‘moderate’, while anything above 200 enters the ‘poor’ or worse categories.

According to meteorological predictions, more rain is expected across the National Capital Region throughout the day, which could further lower temperatures and improve air quality, albeit posing risks such as waterlogging and traffic disruptions.

Also Read: Israel-Iran Conflict Escalates: Tehran’s Missile Barrage Met With Israeli Strikes on Fuel Depots

While Delhiites welcomed the monsoon-like showers with joy, authorities have advised caution due to the threat of lightning, uprooted trees, and reduced visibility during the intense downpours.

Delhi on Sunday received a welcome shower of relief from the recent heatwave. Parts of Delhi experienced rainfall, bringing down temperatures and improving air quality.
Updated : Jun 15, 2025, 07:47 AM IST
Delhi on Sunday received a welcome shower of relief from the recent heatwave. Parts of Delhi experienced rainfall, bringing down temperatures and improving air quality. The rainfall, including gusty winds and thunderstorms, has significantly lowered the temperature in Delhi, offering relief from the intense heatwave conditions, providing a much-needed respite from the scorching heat.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a severe thunderstorm and strong wind alert for the city, warning residents to stay indoors. According to the IMD, "moderate to intense spell of rainfall with thunderstorms and lightning, and squally winds reaching speeds of 80-100 kmph" swept through the capital during the early hours. Visuals from Krishi Bhavan, Rafi Marg, and Udyog Bhawan showed heavy rain accompanied by strong winds lashing the national capital, bringing respite from the heat.
Two thundersqualls along with hailstorm activity were recorded at Safdarjung between 0348 to 0350 hrs IST and 0358 to 0400 hrs IST. The first squall saw gusty winds reaching 82 kmph, while the second saw a peak wind speed of 104 kmph, the IMD said.
The weather department urged residents to take precautions. "Stay indoors and avoid travel unless necessary," the IMD advisory said, as flying debris and low visibility posed risks on the roads.
However, the intense wind and rain also disrupted early morning traffic, with waterlogging reported in several low-lying areas. Meanwhile, the national capital continued to reel under intense heat as several parts of the city recorded a maximum temperature of over 43 degrees Celsius on Thursday.
According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), several weather stations across the city reported scorching daytime temperatures until 8:30 AM today, with Ayanagar recording the highest maximum temperature at 45.0°C. The Ayanagar area recorded 45.0°C (Max) / 30.5°C (Min), Palam saw 44.5°C (Max) / 30.2°C (Min), Ridge witnessed 43.6°C (Max) / 26.2°C (Min), Lodhi Road saw 43.4°C (Max) / 29.2°C (Min) and Safdarjung area experienced 43.3°C (Max) / Minimum temperature data.
Earlier this week, the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a warning that Delhi NCR may experience heatwave-like conditions with temperatures potentially exceeding 45°C.
(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by DNA staff and is published from ANI)

title: Relief from Delhi heatwave: Thunderstorms, hail and gusty winds cool Capital - Mathrubhumi English
article_text:
News
India
Kerala
World
Columns
More+
Relief from Delhi heatwave: Thunderstorms, hail and gusty winds cool Capital
News Desk
15 June 2025, 09:26 AM IST
2 min
Share

Delhi experiences thunderstorms, strong winds, and hail, bringing much-needed relief from the prolonged heatwave. IMD issues weather warning. 

People visit the India Gate during a rainy day, in New Delhi | PTI

New Delhi: Delhiites finally got a break from the prolonged heatwave as thunderstorms, strong winds, and hail swept across the city, bringing much-needed relief. The thunderstorms and strong winds, which reached speeds of up to 104 kmph, brought a welcome change to the city's weather. Hail was also reported in some areas, adding to the dramatic weather conditions.

To advertise here, Contact Us

However, the IMD issued a severe weather warning, cautioning residents about the risks posed by flying debris and low visibility on the roads. According to the weather department, a "moderate to intense spell of rainfall with thunderstorms and lightning, and squally winds reaching speeds of 80-100 kmph" swept through the capital during the early Sunday hours. Two thundersqualls along with hailstorm activity were recorded at Safdarjung between 0348 to 0350 hrs IST and 0358 to 0400 hrs IST.

The IMD has advised residents to stay indoors due to the inclement weather as the city will continue to experience cloudy skies, light rainfall, and thunderstorms until June 19. This sudden change in weather has brought a welcome respite from the scorching heat that had been gripping the city for days.

The southwest monsoon is likely to advance over the remaining parts of central and eastern India, along with some areas in northwest India, between June 12 and 18. It is further expected to reach most parts of northwest India, including Delhi, between June 19 and 25. The normal date for the monsoon to arrive in Delhi is around June 30. This year, the monsoon arrived in Kerala on May 24, well ahead of the usual onset date of June 1, and reached Mumbai by May 26, which is 16 days earlier than normal.

article_text:
HOME
NATIONAL NEWS
HEAVY RAIN ALERT: दिल्ली-एनसीआर में अगले कुछ घंटों के लिए भयंकर तूफान और तेज हवाओं की चेतावनी, मौसम विभाग का अलर्ट जारी
Heavy Rain Alert: दिल्ली-एनसीआर में अगले कुछ घंटों के लिए भयंकर तूफान और तेज हवाओं की चेतावनी, मौसम विभाग का अलर्ट जारी
Swati Kumari | Published : Jun 15 2025, 09:40 AM
2 Min read
FB
TW
Linkdin
Whatsapp
Follow Us
Heavy Rain Alert In Delhi
Image Credit: social media
Heavy Rain Alert: दिल्ली में रविवार तड़के तेज हवाओं और बारिश ने गर्मी से राहत दी है। मौसम विभाग ने अगले कुछ घंटों में तूफान और बारिश की चेतावनी जारी की है। 

Heavy Rain Alert: आफत की गर्मी के बाद दिल्ली वालों को बारिश से राहत महसूस हुई। राजधानी दिल्ली में रविवार तड़के मौसम ने अचानक करवट ले ली। तेज हवाओं और मूसलधार बारिश ने सुबह-सुबह लोगों को भीषण गर्मी से राहत मिली है। भारतीय मौसम विभाग ने दिल्ली-एनसीआर के लिए अगले कुछ घंटों में भयंकर तूफान और तेज हवाओं की चेतावनी जारी की है।

41 डिग्री सेल्सियस से ऊपर चला गया था तापमान

शनिवार को राजधानी का तापमान 41 डिग्री सेल्सियस से ऊपर चला गया था। मौसम विभाग ने शाम या रात में आंधी और हल्की बारिश की संभावना जताते हुए ऑरेंज अलर्ट जारी किया था। हालांकि, रात 8:30 बजे तक कोई वर्षा नहीं हुई और उमस भरी गर्मी बनी रही।

यह भी पढ़ें: MP Weather Today: मध्य प्रदेश के 47 जिलों में तेज आंधी-बारिश का अलर्ट, जानें कब पहुंचेगा मानसून

रविवार को राजधानी में तेज बारिश

रविवार सुबह IMD के मुताबिक राजधानी में गरज-चमक के साथ मध्यम से तेज बारिश हुई और 80-100 किलोमीटर प्रति घंटे की रफ्तार से तेज हवाएं चलीं। कई इलाकों में पेड़ टूटकर सड़कों पर गिर गए, जिससे यातायात प्रभावित हुआ। सफदरजंग में दो बार गरज के साथ बारिश दर्ज की गई और ओले भी गिरे। पहले तूफान में हवा की रफ्तार 82 किमी/घंटा रही जबकि दूसरे में 104 किमी/घंटा तक पहुंच गई।

About the Author
Swati Kumari
स्वाति कुमारी मौजूदा समय में एशियानेट न्यूज हिंदी डिजिटल में कार्यरत हैं। इन्होंने पत्रकारिता में स्नातक किया है। 2022 से अपने करियर की शुरुआत करते हुए इन्होंने अपराध, राजनीति, मनोरंजन और स्थानीय समाचारों पर रिपोर्टिंग में अपनी दक्षता दिखाई है। न्यूज़रूम के बाहर, उन्हें यात्रा करना, नई संस्कृतियों का अनुभव करना और आम लोगों से अपने लेखन के लिए प्रेरणा पाना पसंद है। एशियानेट न्यूज हिंदी से पहले ये पत्रिका डिजिटल में काम कर चुकी हैं।
